Reviews.Content: Lake Eve is a great place to stay while on holiday in Orlando. we are a family of 4 with 2 teens of 15 and 13 , great location and lots to do . special mention to Frank at the main desk who helped out when I locked the car keys in the hire car, once again thanks Frank

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Vay_KayK8e
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Hotwire for approx. $100/night – a great find for a two bedroom/two bathroom condo. This hotel is comparable to Vistana Village (which is right across the street). It is in a great location if you are going to Disney. The hotel appeared to be new and our room was very nice. It had new appliances, furniture etc. The bathrooms were very large – loved the Jacuzzi tub! The patio was also great – we could see fireworks at night. We stayed on July 4th so the hotel was a little noisy as I am sure most hotels were that night. Our only complaint would be that the wait for the elevator was a little long every time we needed to use it. Also, I’m not sure why valet parking is offered for the small parking lot, but you don’t have to use it. It was a great stay. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great family accomodation in a nice spot.”
Reviews.Author: neilgsxr69
Reviews.Content: This was our 17th visit to Orlando and we have always tried different accomodation so this was our first stay at Lake Eve and I must say it's one of the best we've stayed in.All staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble.We had a problem with the lighting in our room and the maintainance guy took only 5 minutes to come and sort it out.There were complimentary valet parking when the hotel got busy,most hotels charge for this.Rooms are very spacious with quality furniture and lovely large beds.The daily maid service was spot on and supplied us with clean towels and consumables,even if we put out do not disturb the maid would leave a bag of towels and consumables on our door handle top service! The room balcony though not very private as they all overlook each other we were on the top floor and had a great view.Pool allthough quite small was clean and well maintained all the photos you see show the pool shaded but from about 10am to about 3pm you could get a tan at the side of the pool.Overall a lovely place to stay just a short drive to any of the attractions.We will definitely return to Lake Eve Resort in the future and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places to stay with family!”
Reviews.Author: MsDanger
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice while vacationing with my in-laws. I visit Orlando often just as a couple and have stayed in many different hotels, but when traveling with a group more than 4, its more comfortable to stay in a condo style hotel. The first time I booked through Hotwire, and the 2nd time around I wanted to stay here again. Although its not advertised online when I called in they gave me a previous guest discount. We booked both times the 2 bedroom suite, which comes with a King size master suite with a huge luxurious bathroom as well as 2 queens in the 2nd bedroom and a sofa bed. The first time around we got a 1st floor room I didn't care for. The second time we were placed in a high floor room with a great view. We could see the Disney fireworks from the balcony. There's a restaurant on property as well as a pool with jacuzzi, fitness room and sauna/steam room. I found the pool to be pretty small compared to how large the hotel was. The rooms are somewhat tastefully decorated and clean. There are All the appliances are modern. Its pretty close to Aquatica/Seaworld and there are grocery stores in the surrounding area but the immediate area seems remote. I really enjoyed my stay here both times, and its probably one of the only places I will stay when traveling with the family, my in laws loved it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel shame about the lift !”
Reviews.Author: malkyandlizm
Reviews.Content: great hotel handy for just about anywhere you would want to go, hotel bus shuttle was good for parks very reliable, all facilities good, rooms large and well equipped, pool area not the biggest but never too busy, only negative was lifts , very slow and unreliable not sufficient for a hotel as large as this, staff helpful and food in hotel good although gratuity is added to bill

Reviews.Title: “This Property is nice and clean, but DOES NOT offer a true resort experience”
Reviews.Author: LikesToTravel_99
Reviews.Content: This property is really a very nice looking VILLA HOTEL with one pool in the back. It was clean with updated furnishings. Using the word "RESORT" in their name does not make them a resort. If you are looking for a true resort experience with ample amenities (basketball, walking trails, tennis, multiple restaurants, pool activities, etc) for the entire family, please carefully consider other true resort properties. CAUTION - They also present themselves as a 3.5 -star resort on discount hotel websites. They are absolutely NOT. They get two stars for false advertising. The property is nice, but I was looking for a true resort. Having booked this property on hotwire, I could not cancel the reservation. Not happy with hotwire either. They’ve lost a customer.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel- Fire Alarm Works Great- Very Poor Wireless Internet”
Reviews.Author: illhavetraffic
Reviews.Content: I too was staying here the morning of June 17, 2011 for my daughtera volleyball tournament in Orlando. My 3 kids, wife and I were awoken to the shrill alarm sounding in our room telling us that an emergency situation existed, and we needed to evacuate and not to use the elevators. The alarm in our room was so loud, it could have woken the dead. I didn't call the front desk, we just evacuated as were told. I don't know what the previous poster wanted from an $8.00 per hour 3rd shift desk clerk who is answering about 100 calls from people who can't follow directions in an emergency, but whatever. We did have to walk down 11 flights of stairs, then back up a couple hours later. The 10-15 fire engines and firefighters going in and out told me that something was going on and that was good enough for me. Lucky I remembered to grab the keys to my rental car before leaving my room, so the kids were able to sit in the car and watch movies (Although fire trucks and rescue squads are more exiting to 8 and 12 year olds.) Most people were stuck sitting or standing on the pavement. When we checked out on Saturday, there was a letter posted offering an apoligy and explaining what happened. The hotel had no control over this and it is unfortunate, but life goes on. As far as the hotel, the rooms are very nice with seperate bedrooms and full kitchens, large bathrooms and showers, and flat screen tv's in every living and bedroom. The pool area is very nice, although several times no pool towels were available and empty drink containers and beer cans littered the pool area after a rainstorm. Overall very nice hotel. Walgreen's, Publix, CVS, and gas stations nearby. About 1.5 miles from Seaworld. The only complaint I have is the wireless internet was about the worst I have ever experienced from a hotel. If you could get on, it was extremely slow and it kicked you out for no reason after a couple of minutes. Grrrrrrrrrrrrr!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: MyTAreviews
Reviews.Content: Nice place. We stayed in a 2 bed suite. The suite was great with kitchen, 2 bedrooms, washer dryer, LCD tv in each room. The resort runs a free shuttle to Disney world, Universal and Seaworld. They also offer complimentary parking. There's an external agency in the lobby selling tickets for Disney World, SeaWorld, Universal. I found Jon to be very well informed and helpful. Reason for rating it 4/ 5 is that we thought the room cleaning service could have been better and the kitchen could probably be equipped better. Overall, its a great place and met most of our requirements. Would certainly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Frank saved the day.”
Reviews.Author: moravek4
Reviews.Content: My daughter was staying at Lake Eve with her volleyball team this last week. She misplaced her stuffed animalthat she has had since she was a few years old. When I called the holel, (my wife and I live in Chicago), and talked a gentlman by the name of Frank, he went above and beyond the call of duty to help find my daughter's stuffed animal. I can't thank him enough for all he did. He was terrific!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It could be a great place...Not on this visit”
Reviews.Author: IraBfromCSG
Reviews.Content: Lake Eve Resort has a very convenient location, nearby Seaworld, the Convention Center and most other Orlando attractions. The rooms are modern, with fully equipped kitchens, multiple bedrooms, and new TV's in every room. Bathrooms are large, with whirlpool-style tubs and separate showers. The pool area is beautiful. The first impression was that this would be one of the best experiences ever! Unfortunately, we were awakened by a fire alarm at 12:30 am on a Friday. We were evacuated to the parking lot, where we remained until about 2:30 am, after walking down 13 flights of stairs. Apparently there was some issue that set off the sprinkler system on the 12th floor, and the sprinklers flooded the elevator shaft. The hotel cannot be responsible for a patron setting off an alarm, and safety is paramount, but the fire alarm did show the hotel's lack of preparedness for this type of event. 1.) The front desk staff did not know how to react when the alarm started. People were calling the front desk to ask if they should evacuate or if this was a system error, and the clerk could not answer. Fortunately, there was a hotel guest who was a retired fire fighter who walked the clerk through standard operating procedures such as identifying the fire panel, where the alarm was coming from, etc. 2.) During the two hours in the parking lot, there was no communication from the staff. Some guests were still on their balconies or stairway landings, and some floors were not evacuated at all. At about 2 am, staff members started handing out towels, what we were supposed to do with them I'm not really certain (most used them as pillows). 3.) After the fire, the elevator shaft in question was understandable closed off, leaving just two elevators for a 14+ story building. Long lines (20 minutes+) formed for the remaining elevators throughout the weekend. 4.) There was never any explanation for the cause of the alarm, nor basic apology - Even a note slipped under the door stating the cause of the issue and any advice on the elevator challenges would have been a nice touch. Through the gossip channels, hotel guests seemed to conclude that the cause of the fire was a patron throwing a lit cigarette into a potted plant. This seemed plausible, since there were a number of people drinking at the pool area and in the hallways all weekend. I'd probably guess that the hotel is a nice place to stay if nothing challenging happens - I just wouldn't want to take the chance again with the number of options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_ILOrange_man
Reviews.Content: I landed here from Hotwire and I couldn't be more pleased. I never heard of this place and never would have stayed here on my own if it wasn't for Hotwire. I really got lucky. I really enjoyed my stay. The full kitchen, comfortable beds, spacious and clean rooms were all part of this great experience. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Jocelyn421
Reviews.Content: They have 2 bdrm and 3 bdrm suites that I stayed in and they were so beautiful! Granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, full kitchen. Great huge pool with a pool bar. Restaurant onsite as well. Very close to Sea World. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gladly stay here again. Would recommend to others.”
Reviews.Author: DonnaDanks
Reviews.Content: Stayed between 2-16 May 2011. The apartment surpassed our expectations. Absolutely loved our 2 bedroom apartment, although probably a little too big for just the two of us, although it did mean we could both get showered at the same time. The reception staff were extremely helpful and accommodating - couldn't have asked for anything more. We did experience a problem whilst we were there however someone was sent to our room with 90 minutes (and that was at 22:00). The view from our 13th floor room was fantastic, overlooking the pool and Lake Eve. The pool area can start to get shaded by 14:00-15:00 hours in the afternoon, but this didn't seem to bother most people. Location wise, there is a Walgreens and Publix just down the road (you could actually walk there). In the other direction there is a petrol station and Pik N Run mini-supermarket which also sold hot/cold food. We absolutely loved it here and the location is fantastic the only thing that I could comment negatively about is the housekeeping. It was tidied around everyday but I don't think that the floors were mopped or vacuumed the whole time we were there. When you got out of the shower, your feet would be dirty again within 10 minutes! On the whole though we had a great time and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adriane_RBe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at ths hotel with my husband and my 3 year old daughter in May 2011 and would come back again certainly. It is a very new hotel and so all the rooms are very new, well decorated, spacious and confortable. There's a big swimming pool and an astonishing and relaxing lake view. The staff of the hotel is very friendly too and it's very well located, close to a big Publix and a Walgreens, close to Disney parks, Sea World and Premium Outlet. I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant . it really is. Could be awesome with a few changes.”
Reviews.Author: johnbrady
Reviews.Content: You want it- you got it. Great location ,comfortable, ,just go. The only thing missing - radio cd player. The resturant is nice.However menu said- fresh fish- nope it was frozen. Eat out. Rooms need to be painted cream or white- then perfect. I think it is a light nicotine colour. I'm being picky except for the fish. We going back. Change the paint colour provide a cd radio,dont eat the fish and you have a 5* instead of a 4* Even with these flaws we going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family holiday”
Reviews.Author: HarwoodFamily
Reviews.Content: Spotless resort with very friendly staff. Accommodation was very spacious and easily accomodated 7 people. Great location that served all the major attractions either by the free shuttles provided by the hotel or by the Irolley or buses. Good size swimming pool and clever design ensures all rooms have a view of Lake Eve! We will be returning to the hotel to ensure we see more of what Florida has to offer as 10 nights just wasn't enough.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague.”
Reviews.Author: DoforNo1
Reviews.Content: This resort are very good at charging your credit card without informing you. You only find out when you next receive your credit card statement. When you try to contact the resort they will not answer your emails and when you phone and ask for a manager there is no one available 'at this time'. I booked and paid for 15 nights and have the booking invoice to prove this. We actually stayed 14 nights, the extra one we paid for was to accomodate our late flight home. When we first entered our room we found the place to be rather dirty, lights not working and the lights over the kitchen area flickering on and off. The cooker had not been cleaned since day one and mixed assortment of kitchen utensils were also dirty. The refrigerator had a broken drawer and the coffee maker was mouldy from the last pot of coffee to be made as the bag was still in there! We reported these faults to the desk and the broken drawer was replaced the next day. NOTHING ELSE WAS DONE! We asked 4 times for a change of room but finally gave in as we did not want to spend our holiday waiting at the reception desk. Having decided to clean the place to our standards we were even further dismayed to get no room service for 2 days which resulted in us washing our own towels. On our return I found I had been charged for an extra night and for the cost of the broken refrigerator drawer. I sent an email to Lake Eve asking for an explanation and had to resort to embarrassing them on Facebook to get an answer. This is when I found out about what the charges were for. I have emailed back to say we paid for the nights we stayed and sent proof and to also check their records to see that we reported the broken drawer. THEY HAVE NOW GONE QUIET AGAIN! NO REFUND AND NO CONTACT! I have visited Orlando over 20 times and have never had problems like this. Other hotels and resorts have been only too pleased to correct any faults that have occured and also seem pleased to welcome your business. Lake Eve is another matter! It has been reported on Tripadvisor before about the valet parking system they run at weekends. They form a one way system with traffic cones and put up a sign saying there is limited parking and to use valet parking. The car park is hardly the size of a football pitch so why on earth would anyone require valet parking. The idea is to get a few more dollars out of you. Maybe Lake Eve would care to reply to my comments on Tripadvisor as they do not seem to want to reply to me in person or give me back my money that was wrongfully taken from my credit card. The sales and marketing person responsible for this debacle is a certain Amanda Simon. Maybe one of her seniors would care to reply. I would certainly not stay at Lake Eve again as there are hundreds of other resorts in Orlando that give better service and do not try to gain a few extra dollars from your credit card after you have left.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Leanneruby
Reviews.Content: I would first like to thank the staff of Lake Eve for there excellent service in all areas of the hotel. We could not fault anything..( A special mention to Rolando :) ) We booked our holiday on the basis of having a hotel room that was more like a villa than just a room with a bathroom. We had read the reviews and although there was a few negative comments ( none of which worried us) we believed we had picked the best hotel for ourselves and our children. When we arrived we were very happy with the location and the look of the hotel, we had a very easy check in, and made our way to our room. Lets say we stood there with our mouths opened when we opened the door. We had booked a two bedroom suite, and the floor space was not far of the size of a large flat.. It was huge, with a beautiful modern kitchen ( american fridge freezer, ice maker, water dispenser, dishwasher huge cooker and microwave, coffee machine toaster all the plates and utensils you would need for a family of four + ). The children were excited to explore all the different doors and what they would lead too. There was a huge family bathroom, a huge twin room ( the boys couldnt believe the size of their beds) and lots of storage and hanging space. There was also a flat screen tv.. In the master bedroom again it was beautifully furnished, flat screen tv, lots of storage safe, and a huge en-suite with a jacuzzi and walk in shower. The living are was very substancial with a dining area too. There was also a washer/dryer which was ingeniously designed and hid away. There was an abundance of towels, and extra bedding, and they even left washing up liquid, dishwasher powder and coffee. The staff could not be more helpful in any request, the cleaning staff were fantastic, and the pool was meticulously cleaned every morning. We were never hassled once for valet service which was mentioned in a previous review, if you wanted it you asked if you didnt then you just walked to your car. The car park was well lit and we never felt intimidated at all if we arrived after dark. There was a small shop which was reasonably priced, a nice restaurant, a gym ( which i really should have used ) a good size pool which was never too busy, computer access and free wireless internet. Another thing I would like to mention is that the shuttle bus was a FREE of charge bus, which you booked the evening before. The location was fantastic, we did not have to use the I4 once as we were able to get to disney/ universal/seaworld all by using international drive, 536 and universal boulevard. Walmart was off the 535 ( a five minute drive) disney 10 mins max, universal 10 mins and Seaworld you can see from your suite balcony. I would like to say we have had a variance of experience, as over the last four years we have stayed in 2 different villas ( one a pretigious gated community) and another hotel chain. This by far has been our personal favourite. We are holidaying in Florida October 2012 with a large party of our family, and we will definately be staying here. So see you soon Lake Eve, it was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: dawnc86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great to stay at. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. We would phone the front desk for help or to book taxis and they were always efficient. The hotel apartment was very clean and cleaners came in daily to replace towels. We used their shuttle service to the parks frequently but the times home were often inconvenient to us so we got taxis home from the parks which were always reasonably priced. There is an i trolley stop right outside the hotel which made travelling cheaper as we had a 2 week travel pass which i would advise for. We booked this over the internet before we left. I would highly recommend this hotel especially for its friendly staff, Phillip the bar tender went out of his way to provide a good service and was so nice, he also makes amazing frozen cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Super..Great..Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IMNEARSICKOFTHISNOW
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 weeks in Lake Eve from 6th May 11, 2 bed 703, apartment massive 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom both with showers one with Jacuzzi bath (Class), full kitchen with american fridge, micro, dishwasher, washer and dryer....what more could you ask for - nothing... Staff great, pool great. Good location. Free car parking. I Trolley service outside apartments. Premier outlets/Publix (our tesco)/Subway etc, a ten minute walk south. Love: Premier outlets..Subway, outdoor cafe..great for people watching. Love: Ralph Lauren prices/Oakley Prices and Tommy Hilfiger...ladies jeans @ $29 only £20, tried the same pair on in Belfast and £90. We will be back next year to Lake Eve..it is Brill...

Reviews.Title: “Delighted”
Reviews.Author: Wightmaster
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at lake eve resort, not only was the level of accommodation excellent the staff were very friendly and helpful . We would recommend this resort to anyone and will certainly be visiting again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. Comfortable, spacious, clean....read on for more details...”
Reviews.Author: angela2323
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Lake Eve from 29th April - 12th May. First time in Florida. Checked into our room early evening. Room 111 on ground floor. Would have liked to be higher up for better views from balcony but knew we wouldn't be in the hotel much anyways. Booked with Thomson and was given a 2 bedroomed apartment which as most of the reviews state was more like a condo than an apartment. Absolutely huge, spotless, clean, massive bed, amazing bathroom. Could not fault it one little bit. Used kitchen once and made good use of washer and dryer. All worked fine. No hiccups. Water form shower was sometimes cold but just had to give it 5 minutes to warm up first. Jacuzzi bath got used a few times...especially to soak my aching feet! Electricity power struggled to cope with our high powered hairdryer and the one provided in the bathroom was just as weak. Speaking as a woman with long hair...you can see how this caused an inconvenience. Just had to bear with it during the holiday. Only lazed round the pool on one of our days. Poolside service was excellent. Food was lovely. Very clean and well kept surroundings. Ate in hotel restaurant for breakfast on 2 mornings. Buffet style. Excellent to fill you up ready for a full day at the parks. Also ate in restaurant on 2 evenings. Again, couldn't fault the food or service. Lake Eve is situated at the bottom of International Drive so my only gripe if I have to have one would be the overall location. And here are my reasons why....no restaurants around, had to take I ride trolley up to middle of International Drive. Public transport in Florida is a joke anyways (I will be hiring a car next time) and the taxi's that the front desk order you are so expensive. If you don't have a car I highly recommend using the free shuttle bus that the hotel provides on a morning to the parks. They are available back aswell at 7:30pm and 10:00pm. Did not use them for return travel as the times weren't always suitable but atleast you know you have the option there. Another note to mention about transport is the I ride trolley which travels up and down International Drive. Have to say I hated these things. Cramped, uncomfortable, felt like you were waiting ages for them to come and one of the drivers obviousely loved her job so much that she shouted at most of the passengers and made them feel stupid. Lake Eve is stop number 39 out of 41 so it takes almost an hour to get from Stop 10 to 39 if there are people at each stop along the way. Highly frustrating after a long day when all you want to do is get back to the hotel. (another reason why I will definitely hire a car next time) Rant over!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Rating, Best service and friendly staff Best value.”
Reviews.Author: CasperFamily
Reviews.Content: MY Family and I stayed for 8 days at Lake Eve Resorts, My wife and I and our 7 yr old son & our 9 yr old daughter. Just so every one knows I do not work for Lake Eve or anyone affiliated with them. I'm a simple car wholesaler from the "D" that's Detroit, MI. And From the moment we walked in the front door all I can say is WOW!!!. The staff is professional , kind and friendly. The two bedroom suite we had was over the top nice. high end everything. Marble counters stainless appliances, tile floor, beds so comfortable if it would have fit in my suitcase it would have come home with me. view to die for. And for clean, it looked like no one ever stayed there before us. everything you needed was provided for, from silverware to cups. dishwasher, sidebyside frig, washer & dryer, and more. The pool was cleaned everyday along with the pool bathrooms. I saw cleaning and painting going on the entire time. The staff was the best, you could not walk by a staff member without them asking how things are and if you needed anything. Even in broken English they did their best to make us feel like family and went out or I should say above and beyond to ensure that we felt special. Like we were the only people staying at the resort. the food was very good also. For the money you cannot go wrong. We will be back and Lake Eve is the place to stay. Great place, We will go back soon. The Casper Family. Detroit, MI

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hospitality and clean, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sometime_travelor
Reviews.Content: This was a repeat stay for us, and my husband and I invited our son's family to join us. The staff made us feel so welcome as return customers. We have always been impressed with the hospitality of the entire staff since our first stay here just after they opened in 2009. The rooms are very clean...starting to show some scuffs and wear, but since the quality of the furnishings was so good to begin with, it doesn't really effect the atmosphere. The suites are large, comfortable, and quiet. There is a restaurant on the site, but we didn't have a chance to try it out this visit. We've had breakfast in the past here, though, and it was better than average. We will continue to be making this our hoe away from home when we visit Orlando !

Reviews.Title: “GREAT 1st visit to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: DebsYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at Lake Eve. Large, clean rooms. Great location, hand for I-Trolley (right outside hotel) and good hotel shuttle to Disney Parks (would have been better if last bus left Disney a little later - 10pm last service) but overall a good service. A special mention to Keith and Diane on front desk concierge who really made our holiday - always willing to help and genuinely interested that we were having a great time. We stayed at Easter (spring break) but the hotel and pool never felt full or overcrowded and was lovely to return to after a busy day. Definitely reccomend Lake Eve to friends and hope to stay here again in the future. Thanks to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Probably won't come back”
Reviews.Author: pegstor
Reviews.Content: Waited at front desk 10-15 minutes before someone acknowledged presence, couldn't check in but we were there at around noon which was before check in time, so we returned later. Then we discovered that microwave was missing the turntable, so called and someone came up a while later, and when turned stove on, there was white smoke coming out so we turned it off and decided that we probably shouldn't use it. We also had bed sheets which were stained and had cigarette burns. Also a couple of towels had stains on them, and finally the door to the balcony didn't have a screen door so when you kept it open for a nice Florida breeze, bugs would fly in. Definately not impressed and would suggest you think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrated Patron”
Reviews.Author: Wallaces255
Reviews.Content: My family and I checked into your hotel late Friday evening, March 18, 2011. Our stay started out pleasant, but on Saturday morning, we noticed that the water was slowly draining, or so we thought, from the bath tub. We were gone from the room all day and returned on Saturday night to a tub full of water. I called the front desk to report the problem and no one showed. In the process of waiting for assistance, we fell asleep. First thing Sunday morning, I called the front desk to report the problem again, waited for about an hour. Still no one showed. I called a third time, waited about an hour before going to the front desk to find out why no one came to correct the problem. Each time I called, the person at the front desk assured me that someone would be up soon. When I checked out, the problem still had not been corrected. On Monday, March 21, 2011 at 1:14 p.m., I called to speak with the General Manager, Lisa Catina. Since Lisa was not available, I left a message on her voicemail. At 3:15 p.m., Lisa returned my call and upon checking the call logs, she said that each call was showing completed. She said that the problem had been corrected, I assured her that the problem was not corrected while I was staying at the hotel. Lisa assured she would check into the situation and call me back on Wednesday because she was not working on Tuesday. To date, I have not received a call from Lisa. Even after leaving messages on her voicemail on 3/25/11 @ 10:47 a.m., 4/4/11 @ 3:02 p.m., and 4/5/11 @ 5:44 p.m. On 4/4/11, I spoke with Daisy. I asked if there was anyone else that I could speak with, she told me that Lisa was the General Manager, and the only person that I could speak with about a complaint. On 4/7/11 @ 8:49 a.m., I called and was transferred to Dana, Sales Manager. I left a message on her voicemail. Still no return call from anyone there. Is this how Lake Eve treats it patrons, get their money and ignore their concerns? That is exactly how I feel right now. I feel my concerns were totally ignored and assumed minute. My family has been coming to this resort for family gatherings for the past three years. There are talks of another gathering next year, but I am reluctant to attend with them again because of the way that I have been treated.

Reviews.Title: “They gave away our reservation”
Reviews.Author: TH1969
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. We booked our suite 5 months in advance and even confirmed the reservation the week before we left. When we arrived we were told that our credit card had been declined so our reservation had been cancelled. This is totally a lie - our credit card was totally paid off and had over $ 30,000 available on it. The problem is that we flew in at approx 11:00 pm and they had oversold the hotel. Since we were one of the last ones to arrive our reservation was cancelled. What was totally frustrating is that the front desk staff was very rude to us and did nothing to help us. They treated us very badly. It seems that Lake Eve regularly overbooks and then the last people to arrive are out of luck - Do not stay at this hotel - they treat you terribly.

Reviews.Title: “LAKE EVE IS ALOVELY HOTEL WITH GREAT STAFF.”
Reviews.Author: dee61
Reviews.Content: What a great place Lake Eve is to stay for our anual florida hol. Myself an hubby stayed here with our daughters and partners and also my parents in march we was having a fab time but then my father was taken ill and was rushed into hospital we were so upset but the hotel staff was fantastic especially Marie who was so helpful and also the holiday rep who also helped us whilst my father was in hospital. they helped us sort everything out and helped us carry on best we could whilst having to travel back and forwards to hospital etc to visit my father. we had to fly home without him beacuse he was so ill that a doctor had to fly back with him once he was fit enough to fly. My father is still ill and is waiting for heart surgery back in the uk but without the help of everyone concerned at Lake Eve and the hospital and the holiday company it may have been a rather different review so from all of the family we would like to say a massive thankyou to you all and hopefully will visit Lake Eve in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous All-Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTravels2
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter and I stayed at the Lake Eve Resort for three nights at the end of our March Break trip to Orlando. Although I reserved a one-bedroom suite, we were given a three-bedroom suite with a balcony overlooking the large swimming pool. The suite was beautifully appointed; even the website photos did not do the room justice. Even during the busy March Break-period, our room was very quiet. There is a restaurant in the hotel but we only ate one breakfast there. The buffet breakfast was very inexpensive and available at a discount if you pre-paid at least the night before. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We arrived in early in the morning and my request for an early check-in was cheerfully accommodated. I also appreciated the knowledgeable agent selling tickets to the Orlando theme parks in the lobby. Located on International Drive, the Lake Eve Resort is within easy driving distance of the airport and the major Orlando attractions. Although shuttles are offered to Disney and Universal Studios and the I Ride Trolley stops nearby, I would highly recommend having a car if you wanted to explore Orlando from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel the rooms were great and the staff we exceptional, Thanks Lake Eve Resort for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Marnor1
Reviews.Content: We loved the area, the hotel was just minuntes away from many of the attractions and sites. Staff were helpful and courtious. Disney was just 10 min. for the hotel and wet & wild just 5 min. away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! - This is a true review!”
Reviews.Author: princessmsb
Reviews.Content: Just returned home on Friday from our vacation to Florida. Our first week was spent here at Lake Eve (March 17th ) THIS IS ALSO SPRING BREAK TIME (very busy at parks) (myself, my partner both in our 30's) 3 boys, 10, 9 & 5. We had a great welcoming at Lake Eve, arrived early at 2pm to be told room was not ready until 4pm but we would be upgraded to a platinum suite (2 bed)!! We were well chuffed (happy)!! Arrived back at just before 4pm, room was ready. Reception staff were excellent! We proceeded to our room which was absolutely lovely, overlooking the lake and Orlando skyline. Nothing could be faulted with their customer service and even when a cold shower problem arose, the maintenance man arrived promptly with new shower head and we were informed of ongoing boiler maintenance. This was going to be carried out overnight so as not to disturb guests! Have stayed at many resorts in Orlando and this is highly rated and would not hesitate to return! The pool was lovely and warm, clean towels always available, not over crowded, only negative that can be said (by other trip advisors also ) pool is shaded during the morning and then again later afternoon due to orientation of building!!! But as there are many places to visit this wasn't really a problem! Easy access to I4 and other major attractions, located on quiet end of I Drive South! You will not be disappointed!! Weather was awesome during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mom_s_1977
Reviews.Content: I was at orlando for a vacation with my 18 month old, 5 years old, husband and my parents. We booked two bedroom suite. Everything about this place is good. The apartment was very spacious and clean. I had read about the cold water, thefts, hard beds, bed bugs in the earlier posts after I did the booking and at one point thought of canceling my reservation but I am very glad that I did not because it proved to be an excellent stay, Each apartment has a washer/dryer, an ac unit for even turning the heat on!( for us we did at one time because it was getting very cold). The water was warm at all the times ( make sure not the turn off the main control switch of the apartment before going to sleep ), The countertops of the kitchen were granite and very clean. The flooring was clean and yes I enjoyed the balcony with the view of the lake. We bought our own groceries ( publix is close by ) and cooked there. They have all the utensils one needs along with the plates and cups. The only thing missing was a rice cooker! We did not use the pool - looked clean from the balcony! The internet and the cable were both fine. We had couple of stormy days during our visit and we could not go out. We were very glad we had chosen this place with lots of space for my children to run around and I would recommend it to any one of my friends without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 154913Disappointed
Reviews.Content: Be very careful if you plan to stay here. I had read the reviews and was looking forward to our stay. I booked my reservation online in early February for our stay in March. We arrived around 5 pm at the hotel to check-in only to be told that our credit card was declined and that our reservation had been cancelled. We were also informed that the hotel was now full and they could not accommodate us for any of the five nights that we had pre-booked. They said that they had tried to contact me. I assured them that there was no way that my credit card could be declined and I checked all my voice mails, caller ids and emails only to find that they had not tried to reach me. We asked to see the manager and were told that she had left for the day and that there wasn't a manager available - that we could call her tomorrow - alot of good that was going to do us when we needed a room that night!!! The worst part was that the front desk staff had no interest in trying to help us. Clearly an error had been made and we needed some assistance. We travelled from very far, were new to the area and had no idea where to stay. While this was going on another customer arrived - she had also pre-booked a number of rooms for a family birthday party only to be told that her credit card had been declined, as well. I found this very interesting - we all were there close to check-in time, the hotel was full and we are told that our credit cards were declined???? Upon further checking with my credit card company, I found out the reason my card was declined was because they entered the wrong expiry date. I am quite sure that I did not give them the wrong expiry date, but mistakes can happen and perhaps I did, or they entered it wrong. Regardless, they should not have given away our reservation without trying to contact us and they would not try to assist us to find another accommodation. We and the other group of people were all made to feel like lowly peasants that couldn't afford a room there. What I find also interesting in reading some reviews up my return, is that other customers have been told their credit cards were declined - is there a staff member there that doesn't know how to enter credit card numbers correctly OR is this their way of getting out of their pre-booked reservations when they can sell their rooms perhaps??? for a higher price? Who knows, but something is suspicious???? I also did call the manager to discuss this matter, but have still not heard back from her. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. It looks great and the prices are great, but will you have a room when you get there?

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: juniper4ya
Reviews.Content: This place screwed us out of our long pre-existing reservation, that we direly needed after a long long drive. It's apparently their policy to give up reservations if they have a surge of people wanting to stay the night. That's great unless you are running late and show up close to 10pm, tired and ready to crash - only to be turned away into the night. I want the world to know of their injustice which they say is 'policy' - (although they had no such policy in writing). They suck - stay away!!!! They are plenty of other great hotels in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Many issues - must read!”
Reviews.Author: grrtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week from March 15-March 22 to get away from work and enjoy some much needed R&R in the Orlando area. Having read many of the reviews before booking my stay I knew there were some issues but figured most could be overcome with it being a 2010 Expedia Insiders pick resort. Turns out there were many other issues we faced. Here are the pros and cons of our stay: CONS: LIVING ROOM - Ceiling fan only worked on low setting. No switch on light to turn on or off. Moved the couch to find one of the TV remotes that went missing and apparently they don't vacuum back there - gross! Stiff furniture. KITCHEN - When I walked in the base of the stove was off the hinges and had to be put back together (they use all HOTPOINT (cheap) appliances in their units - Dishwasher was very loud. Lights would flicker on and off. Faulty power outlet. HALLWAYS/COMMON AREAS - Smelled terrible - sometimes fishy, mostly like old cheese/clammy. BEDROOMS - Beds were hard and lumpy. Banging noises on the walls and ceilings all hours of the day and night (thin walls - you can also hear everything in the hallway as you pass by rooms). No Bibles noted. CUSTOMER SERVICE - Night audit didn't take our credit card information upon arrival (booked thru Expedia) to pay for additional room tax - was woke up the next morning at 8am by the front desk manager asking us to bring our credit card down. Same person checked us out and couldn't get a receipt to print and also tried to tell us there was no additional charge for room tax! There was no response to my email request to upgrade to 2-bedroom unit with king size bed, even after it was offered to us for $10 more a night. We were bombarded with pizza delivery advertisements twice daily. Delivery guys would park in no parking zones or handicap spots while making deliveries to resort. CABLE TV - Service kept going out (they have nice flat screen TV's but very cheap cable service (grainy picture) - no HD). Power buttons on TV's didn't work and one of the remotes stopped working half way thru our stay. BATHROOM - The toilet seat was plastic and also crooked. Sink was plastic and cheap - wasn't even installed properly or broken. First night there, sat in the jacuzzi tub and had black things floating in the water (mold from the water lines?). Power outlet breaker kept tripping when running the blow dryer they have mounted on the wall. Sink was plugged up - didn't drain properly. No hot water for showers or sinks - warm at best, but mostly cold. No hand lotion. Very cheap paper products (sand paper like toilet paper). ROOM CARD KEYS - Kept self deactivating. Had to go to front desk to reactivate - other guests having same issue. PARKING - Every part of lot was marked with cones - they try to get you to use "complimentary" valet service - just park your car yourself, if you can find a spot. POOL AREA - Towels were all stained and discolored. Pre-showers were broken - 1 or 2 had a trickle of water that came out. No sun in pool area until afternoon. COMPUTER/INTERNET - SD card readers on computers do not work. SECURITY - Nigh security guard (older guy) sat in chair in lobby most of his shift. PROS: Very close to all the attractions. Good place to stay if your looking for a fairly clean unit and can overlook all the cons. It was nice to have a fridge and oven to use and feel at home with. Dishwasher came in handy, as did the in room washer/dryer unit. Soap/dryer sheets sold at reasonable price on site. Housekeeping staff kept dishwasher soap packets stocked. Condo had nice deck over looking the pool area. Made use of the sauna as well as the hot tub and pool. Staff was always pleasant to deal with, but need a little more training. We left the "do not disturb" card on the door so staff wouldn't come in our room. We came home every day with a bag of fresh towels and necessities hanging on door which was nice to have. Equipped with basic cooking necessities (pans, etc). Filtered water from the fridge. Good room layout, but small for anymore than 2 people. Over all a fairly decent place to stay if you can get a good internet deal. I wouldn't ever pay more than $100 a night to stay here - try a package deal instead with airfare or car rental included - much better value. This wouldn't be the place to stay if you are truly looking for all of the "resort" amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Beans1284
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews on here are very accurate. If you're looking for a great deal - inexpensive, nice, clean resort that's within driving distance of the major attractions, Lake Eve is great. We were a bit hesitant to stay here with the negative reviews, but felt that the issues were ones we could deal with for the price we'd be paying. The front desk staff were kind & everything went as planned. In terms of the other issues mentioned here: Valet - you do not need to use the valet services & can park anywhere else in the lot easily. On the weekend nights, it did get a little more crowded, but the lot itself is small, so it's not a far distance. Pool - the pool is nice, but you will not get any sun as it sits behind the hotel, on the lake. Ads/Menus - Yes, during the afternoon, menus are slipped under the door from local pizzerias. We live in NY, so this was not something we were concerned about. Cleaning - The cleaning staff made the beds & cleaned up the towels. Any clean items in the dishwasher were taken out for you to use. The cleaning staff came once a day - if you were not ready at that time, they weren't able to come back later. Food - save yourself the hassle of trying to determine when/if the restaurant is open. You can easily go down the street to one of about 5 Publix grocery stores & pick up anything you need. This hotel had families, couples, and business travelers, but never felt crowded or too busy. The rooms are huge & new. They have all the amenities of home, which helps you save money when you're visiting the area. Having a full kitchen + washer & dryer is amazingly helpful. Although the hotel is on I-Drive, it is further away from the hectic parts & has very little traffic. The pictures on the website are 100% accurate.

Reviews.Title: “*AVOID THIS HOTEL*”
Reviews.Author: shabner
Reviews.Content: I booked 3, two bedroom suites back in November for a conference that my colleagues and I were attending. The day before we left I emailed to confirm our reservation, I received an email confirmation. The day we left one of my colleagues called to make sure that the hotel knew of our late check-in (our plane did not arrive until 11:30 pm). Upon arriving at the hotel, by this time it was past midnight, we were told that check-in was at 3:00 pm and since we were not there at the allotted time they had given our rooms away. Completely unacceptable! Needless to say we were very upset considering the difficulty we had in locating new rooms during the spring break in Orlando at 12:30 am. We were assured by the man/boy working the desk that our rooms were only given away for the night, and that the rest of our reservation was secured for the next day. Some of our team had to scramble to find another hotel for the night while I had to share 1 bedroom with 3 work colleagues. During this period the night desk person was very rude to us. The next day we tried to confirm the rest of our stay, and the day desk person told us that the entire reservation was given to someone else. Unbelieveable! We had booked for 5 days to attend a work function and were now homeless. The person at the desk actually said to my boss "too bad, so sad" The staff at this hotel are the most unprofessional that I have ever encountered. I'm sure they gave our rooms away to the first people that walked in off the street offering a kick back to them. I will never stay at this hotel again, nor do I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok...”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel153
Reviews.Content: Looking forward to our annual trip to Orlando and to try another nice hotel out, We were really looking forward to this resort and this week. First of all,, It is a beatiful place, very nice, and appealing to the eye. Let me start with the Pro of Lake Eve: a) The pool is nice, but you can only get sun from 10 to 3 other then that you are in the shade.b) The inside of the room is like living in a condo, very nice. c) The washer and dryer were great when you came back from the beach. d) the view of the lake and pool are nice. e) the housekeeping was gracious to clean up everyday and leave clean towels for us, even though we asked them not to clean till our last day, Cons: a) the valet service was to eager to get your bags, park your car, and get your money,, We are young, and we can handle our luggage, They did not speak English, and did not feel comfortable with them driving our rental car, b) the bed was worst, I could hardly walk some mornings, the pillows are cheap, and I was thankful for the hot tub to help my back,,, c) the staff was over friendly at helping you at check in, very disppointed that I almosted needed a translater for them. There was a huge Language barrier until we checked out d) the bill came at check out, and they had failed to take out the deposit of 100.00, we had to stop and have them do that, the night clerk had no idea on what was going on,, really felt sorry for him, e) if you choose to not use the valet parking, parking is limited and there were not many places to choose from. I am not being critical, believe me- It was beatiful in side inside, except the few minor things, We did not try the breakfast there on site, and it really seemed to disappoint the check in clerk, but we had read the reviews. Would we stay here again, I really doubt it, I would of gone back over where we had stayed the previous year, it was in the heart of shopping, close to eating places, the pool got sun for several hours, there was no valet parking, the doors were locked to outside people, and I could sleep the entire night, without having a bad back. But we will go back to Orlando, and it was a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: fostermomma
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutly great. We had a big 2 bedroom 2 bath with full kitchen and best of all a washer and dryer in the condo. All rooms overlook either the pool or lake. We were on a low floor so we could not really see the lake over the trees but it was pretty serene. Staff was friendly but a tad bit slow. They have complimentary valet parking however, the hotel was not that crowded while we were there so we didnt really need it. Beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were huge. We had double sinks in the master bath and a large walk in shower which was great. THis condo was great for any price when you are traveling with children of any age. The pool was heated and awesome. The location is conveinent to about everything and yet out of the hustle and bustle of the tourist stuff so it made it a much quieter stay. We ate breakfast in the room before we left out in the mornings and that saved us a good bit of money on a meal. While we did not cook much we were able to heat up left overs or simple things that again saved us from big meals out. We have stayed in both hotels and rental homes in Orlando and this by far beat them both. We utiilize an Owners Locker (purple bin) for staples and toiletries which makes this an ever better stay for us. Over all this is a great place and a great value for a great place to stay while in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: travelprincess72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lake Eve at the end of February for 3 nights. After getting our rental car we headed to the area of resort which took maybe 10 minutes. We knew check in wasnt for 3 hours so we headed to subway down the road and then went to Publix for some groceries. This was only about a 3 minute drive. We still had 2 hours to go until check in but decided to see if our room was ready. The resort was full and they had not cleaned our room yet and I was worried about our groceries we had just purchased since the weather was in the 80's our entire trip. They had housekeeping come get our things and bring them up to the room. We went to downtown disney for a bit and when we came back our room was ready, half an hour before check in. The hotel, suites and pool area are all very clean. We had a one bedroom suite. There was everything you needed except for a dish strainer if you prefer not to use the dishwasher. Even the washer and dryer worked well. The two double beds were very comfy although the bedroom stayed a tad bit warmer than the rest of the suite. There was also two flat screen TV's, one in the livingroom and one the bedroom. It was nice because the kids could watch what they wanted in the other room. The patio was nice and the view onto the pool was beautiful. We were on the second floor and we couldnt hear the noise from the pool at all. Sea World is only about 3 minutes away, the mall about 5 and Disney is about 10 so it is in a good location. I would not suggest going without a car though. There are not any restaurants or shopping within walking distance. The pool was clean and a nice size. My five year old wanted to live in it! The only thing is that if you are a sun worshipper you will be disappointed. The resort is in a U shape and the pool right in the middle, so you dont get much sun. At any hotel we stay at we always put the do not disturb sign up and just ask for towels and the things we need. We dont see the sense in cleaning it every day for a short stay. With that said I do not know about the integrity of housekeeping. The only bad part of our stay was the restarurant down stairs. They did not have any vegetarian options for my daughter, the menu is small, and charged us the same price for Chicken alfredo without the chicken. It wouldnt have been so bad if the service wasnt TERRIBLE! We were the only ones in the place at 6 pm and it took 15 minutes to take our order almost another 30 to get our food and then they added an automatic 8% gratuity. You can change it but I think its pretty presumptous of them if it is not a large party. Also you can only have it charged to your room, you can not pay cash or with a CC. All in all the stay was excellant, just go elsewhere for food.

Reviews.Title: “Lock up ALL belongings!”
Reviews.Author: nscor3
Reviews.Content: Hotel looked very nice in pictures, a safe place to stay. However, I would question their housekeeping staff. The only pair of jeans I brought had disappeared after leaving them hanging on the chair. Hotel states that policy is they are not responsible for lost or stolen items. Who would have thought you would need to lock up ALL of your personal belongings every time you leave your room?! If staying here, I would put up the do not disturb sign and request the items you need. Manager Marie was very understanding, but I am going home to MN with my sisters jeans on! Also, evening staff questioned if I was the one who misplaced them. Clothing walks away here!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Resort”
Reviews.Author: Smrebant
Reviews.Content: I went here with my girlfriend for a quick getaway to get out of the cold weather. We did not rent a car because it showed it a a restaurant on site and work out facilities. The restaurant was only open for a buffet (piitiful) breakdfast until 11:00, no lunch, and the dinner menu was something you would see at a poolside grill. The service in the bar/restaurant if that's what you want to call it was awful. One person who could not keep up with 2 tables. The 2 bedroom suite was beautiful and clean and the people that worked there were very nice but I would not call this a resort more like a condo suite with no amenities. The pool was heated and clean but not very large and the workout facilities consisted of 4 machines.

Reviews.Title: “I received more for my money”
Reviews.Author: Jcruz2800
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Lake eve the weekend before valentines day. Wow, I must say that this place is awesome. Great layout of the rooms, with a beautiful view of the pool area. The room came equipped with all the things you would find in your home. I was able to cook for my girlfriend and had all the kitchen tools needed. I have stayed at all the top notch places and this place competes with them. Only one issue I encountered. There were not enough glasses in the room. I called and within 5 mins someone was at my door with 4 glasses. Great place,my son wants to stay here for his birthday and I think we will.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great room, great location, great pool”
Reviews.Author: biilsusan
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently returned from a 4 night stay @ Lake Eve Resort. We couldn't have been more pleased with our choice. It is on the "quiet side" of International Drive, but very convinient to Sea World, WDW & Universal. An outlet mall & grocery store are a short drive away. The room was extremely clean & well maintained. It contained a kitchen with full sized applicances. A washer & dryer was in the room. Actually the room was more of a condo setting. It had a large flat screen TV that we enjoyed @ night. The pool/court yard area was very well maintained also, with a pool bar & jacuzzi. All the rooms have balconies that look over the pool and have a view of Lake Eve. We will return next for a week,

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Powpowpookie
Reviews.Content: Hotel stay was absolutely fabulous, did not regret this choice at all! The hotel was in a beautiful area and located on a street that would bring you to malls, great restaurants, pharmacy, food store etc. Everything was really close by, we rented an economy car for 5 days and did not even use half the tank! The room was super cozy, beds were so comfortable that I slept better in the hotel than in my own house! Beautiful kitchen with everything you need, including ice dispenser :D We had booked a 1 bedroom suite but were given a 2 bedroom suite instead at no extra charge, so we had 3 beds, two bathrooms, jacuzzi... everything you need to feel relaxed! I went with my husband and 7 month old baby, she absolutely loved the place. We did not get disturbed at all and when we left the room, staff came by to clean everyday. The resort staff were super friendly to my daughter, she had a blast! Great view from the balcony, heated pool.. kids were out swimming at night even when it was freezing cold. There are a lot of great looking hotels in the area, but honestly I loved this hotel so much that the next time I go to Orlando, I'm definitely staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: colony1636
Reviews.Content: Loved this place - view from 14th floor was unbeatable! Great staff (Daisy at front desk) and the room was always cleaned and refreshed on our daily returns to the hotel. PROS: -Large, spacious suite - we were upgraded at no cost from a 1 bedroom to a 2 bedroom -All amenities in suite - fully stocked & working kitchen; washer & dryer in suite - very convenient -Quiet location, yet the I-trolley and bus service right out the door -free shuttle service to Epcot (with transfers to all Disney parks) as well as Universal Studios (the I-Trolley goes direct to Sea World CONS: -Staff either would not or could not get our in-suite telephones to dial out long distance - we had a family emergency back home and had to rely on our own cellular phones -No decent restaurants within walking distance of resort - you either need a vehicle or be willing to bus it or cab it somewhere Overall, it was a great time spent in a great hotel. I would highly recommend staying at Lake Eve Resort and look forward to my next visit there.

Reviews.Title: “We're Going Back to Lake Eve Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Pienkos_Family
Reviews.Content: This resort was a gem of a find when we took a chance and booked a 6 night stay off Hotwire in January 2010. Didn't know we were going to get the Lake Eve, but sure glad that we did! The kids were very impressed with the pool, and the adults loved the space in our 2 bedroom suite along with the kitchen. Location was terrific; quiet but lots of restaurants nearby and only a short drive to Seaworld or Disney. Only downside we can think of is that the resort got really crowded with high school and college age kids on a band trip the last couple of nights we were there, so much so that the pool would not have been a fun place to be on those nights. I suppose, though, that the resort can't be blamed for this, but a little more staff would have helped keep things more in line. This won't keep us away, however.....we just booked a return visit for 6 nights in March 2011. Spring break can't come soon enough!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Halen25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lake Eve Resort 3 different times in 2010. We liked what you get for your money and couldn't think of staying anywhere else for the price. Great 2 bedroom units with kitchen, 2 baths, second bedroom has 2 queen beds which our kids were very glad to see. The resort is just over a year old so there are some growing pains but we couldn't complain about a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: barnett517
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Lake Eve Resort last week and it was Amazing. We are a family of 7 adults and we stayed in the 2 bedroom room w/kitchen etc. This worked so well for our family. We were in Orlando visiting all the parks. It was nice to come back at the end of the day and be able to relax. The hotel was very clean, the employees were very curtious. And it was just great. I would definently recommend staying here if you are visiting Orlando for an extended stay. We will definently stay here if and when we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, Bad Breakfast, Limited Shuttle service to Universal.”
Reviews.Author: MidTransplant
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly loved the 2 bedroom suite, which actually seemed more like an apartment then a hotel suite. Everything from a full kitchen with a dishwasher to a washer and dryer in the suite. Everything was in very good condition. Now I did not examine the place with a magnifying glass as I am sure not every piece of molding was spotless, but honestly I could live with that. The cleanliness of the baths and beds rank higher with me. The downside to the property, Breakfast, Parking and the Shuttle to Universal. BREAKFAST: SAVE YOUR MONEY and Do Not Buy the Breakfast! Just buy something to prepare in your own room or go out to eat. The $5 to $7 charged is just too much for the lousy food that was served (and no real fresh fruit) - even my teenagers, who are happy just to have food and not have to clean up afterwards thought it was bad. Save your money. There is a Publix just down the street and around the corner. We bought eggs and bacon, etc.. for our next breakfast. Second, The Parking: The subcontracted valet guys block off most of the parking lot, to get to the main parking area, you have to go through the valet. It is advertised as free, but as we all know you have to tip them when they take your car and tip them when they go back and get your car. So it really is not free. While I understand the need for valet, (traveling with young children, helping hands to unload the car, elderly, etc..). I personally have never liked handing my keys over to a stranger. So I don't use valet. Because I did not use valet parking, we had to park along the outer edges of the parking lot, and unload and load. It is almost like the parking lot does not belong to the hotel but it is obviously the property of the hotel. So we felt like second class guests - we were not even allowed to use the luggage carts as I guess even those belong to the subcontracted valet/bellmen. So for some folks - not an issue, for me with able bodied teenagers it was an annoyance. I know that seems cheap, but I would rather save the $25 to $50 that is spent on those kind of costs and use it towards something special. (Dessert after dinner, special gift, etc...) Third: The Shuttle to Universal. One of the reasons I selected this property was to get the free shuttle to Universal (not Disney) only to find out that the hotel only runs one trip in the morning and one trip in the evening (they do have one at noon and one at 5pm but what good is that?) but I was traveling with teenagers and Universal was open until Midnight but the shuttle came at 7:45pm - no changes due to the holiday hours at the park. If you plan on driving this would not be a big deal, but it really cut into our time at the park and I was really hoping to stay late. We did not use the pool and while the water temp seemed warm enough, the pool needed to be cleaned of leaves and such. ( It would not have stopped the teenagers from swimming in - we just ran out of time>) I would recommend this hotel if you are traveling with small children, plan to eat in or eat out at restaurants, like valet service and were planning on driving yourself to the park anyway. I think the "suites" are really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Could be much better with decent housekeeping and management.”
Reviews.Author: sunnytimesnj
Reviews.Content: We (Mom, Dad and two young kids) stayed for four nights at the end of November. For those that don't know it the Lake Eve building was built as condos but after the real estate bust it was converted to a condo hotel. It's clearly cheaply done...made to look good for a quick sale (granite, semi stainless appliances, etc.) but cheap work does not last, as is evidenced by the state of the rooms now. They are already showing a huge amount of wear and lack of upkeep. We had a two bed / two bath room which was not ever really clean. Doors did not close properly, there were huge stains on the rugs and curtains. The kitchen cabinets were cracked and the appliances dirty. Every single room had light bulbs that didn't work. The kitchen had only one working light. Three calls to the front desk for new bulbs resulted in absolutely nothing. The walls are paper thin and the toilets got stuffed constantly (maintenance did come and fix this). We did not use the fitness center or pool so I can't comment on how they were. However, our room was overlooking the pool and it was very noisy at night (very late into the night too) with people in there drinking away. There are endless flyers put under the doors (at least 4 a day). There is no real restaurant on site. I think when we were there it was open on the weekend for breakfast only. No room service or useful store. There is a huge Publix down the street (driving) so stop there and stock up before you check-in. All of the above being said, the location was perfect for us. The price was right for a 2 bed 2 bath newish (if not well kept or very clean) condo. If it was clean I would have given 3 stars. If you are used to 4* or 5 * places and are expecting this to be similar you will be extremely disappointed. Only if you are used to staying at Motel 6 would you consider this a luxury resort. The real shame is this place could be a star with better management. The front desk was the worst part of the experience. I have honestly never encountered such ambivalent service. When we checked in the man who checked us in was wearing some type of "street" clothes. Obviously I am showing my age here but I'm not sure when a huge hoodie and jeans worn so low they sit around hips are appropriate for a hotel front desk. As an example of the level of service offered by the front desk I will offer up this: Our keycard stopped working every day as if we had checked out. We would leave for the parks and return at night to find we couldn't get back into our room. Each night we would go to the front desk and they would ask us our room number and how long we were staying and reprogram the key (never asking for name or ID). Trying to enter on our last night I wearily walked downstairs to the front deck and asked "why does this keep happening?" I was answered by a roll of the eyes and a simple "I dunno."

Reviews.Title: “YUCK.”
Reviews.Author: wilmymom
Reviews.Content: This place was a disaster from the moment we walked in. The lobby was dirty, there was only one person working at the front desk who acted like she could've cared less about checking us in, the room smelled (and was dirty, naturally) and the fitness room was disgusting, with 2 out of the 4 pieces of crappy equipment in there busted and wet towels and dishes all over the floor. I will NEVER set foot in this "resort" again as long as I live.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms - the worst service and front desk EVER!”
Reviews.Author: cowtnadv
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, mostly empty hotel, I cna see why! Service at front desk was a joke, really clueless employees, ask for manager and she was unavailable! Someone named Lisa, yea right if they even had one! Do not recommend, obviously their management company dropped them after I talked to them, bad property!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room and great amenities and view”
Reviews.Author: Jussara_Brasil
Reviews.Content: We were surprised by the comfort of the two bedroom suite. All you see in the pictures are really true. The room has everything you need to stay with your family: kitchen with all the facilities, living room with a big flat tv, two bathrooms, one hydromassage bathtub, etc. The view of the lake from the balcony was great! The Hotel has great location and wi-fi internet free. I believe that our housekeeper was the only weak point. Sometimes it was clear that she hadn't done the cleaning and she had just arranged the covers on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations, what more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: paypar
Reviews.Content: So if you're like me, you saw the website for this place and thought this is too good to be true. So let me share my thoughts on this place (while I'm still here!). First, believe the pictures you see on their website. I was in a one bedroom suite, room 104 and it was impeccable. Everything was clean, beautiful and in working order (save 2 minor things). We booked this as part of a package with a Travelocity hotel & flight during thanksgiving, so I'd say I spent about $100/night. Location: very near the Premium outlet (which includes a Publix, so you can get groceries). We also rented a car, which I think is a must if you are going to stay here and get around Orlando properly. Gym: This can't really be called a gym. It had 2 treadmills, 1 exercise bike and 1 elliptical. There was a mens/women's sauna too, which was nice (but I did not use it). I did not use the outdoor pool. Ammenities: first off, you get free wi-fi (but the wi-fi can be slow often. You also get a real suite, which includes a full kitchen, washer and dryer. Bring your own soap, shampoo and lotion. The hotel's soap, shampoo/conditioner are the cheapest I've ever used and I don't recommend you use it! There is no lotion. there is dishwashing detergent for both your dishwasher and for handwashing your dishes (and yes, there are plenty of dishes, pots, utensils, silverware, etc). You have everything you need to cook! there is no sponge to hand wash you dishes though. There is also no laundry detergent so you'll need to buy that. There are two tv's in the room - one outside in the living room and also one in the bedroom. This really was such a nice and spacious place, I wish that I had friends I could invite over to hang out! The hotel does charge an additional $7.50/day but there is also free parking (and also a random free valet which we ignored over the weekend). The customer service at check in and housekeeping could be better, but honestly for the value in the room I would stay here again in a heartbeat. We also somehow got a quiet room, considering this place was filled with families and children.

Reviews.Title: “really nice place!”
Reviews.Author: BournvilleKitty
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for two weeks,check in was vry quick and staff friendly, we loved how spacious the rooms are an were vry clean! was in a great location water parks nearby other parks not too far,supermarket nearby, washin and drying machine which came in handy cleaner came in every day to clean it over which was gr8 ! the only critism that i wud have is the buffet breakfast we tried it the one day it was awful so we just ate out or supermarket other then that cannot fault it great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING, LUXURIOUS, IMMACULATE AND SPACIOUS.”
Reviews.Author: deni2111
Reviews.Content: We travelled with my sister and her family both having three in each party. We decided to each book a two bedroomed suite at the hotel, which my sister decided to upgrade to a larger suite with better views. (tip, if you wish to upgrade, email the hotel prior to arrival and ask for a discount on this, my sister paid 50% less than normal rate). i decided not to upgrade as the rooms slept 8 anyway and we didn't feel the extra space was needed. Boy were we right, the suite was amazing, full kitchen, excellent living area, huge dining table and six chairs, two huge bedrooms with amazingly comfortable humongous beds. the master bedroom had the most fantastic ensuite i've ever experienced, jucuzzi bath, twin sinks, marble tops and a walk in shower big enough for six, i actually screamed and jumped up and down like a 12 year old when i saw this. my daughter had her own bathroom too, if a little smaller but just as lovely. each room had a large flat screen tv with loads of satellite channels, so all 3 of us could watch different things if needed. The air con was a godsend as the temp was soaring outside, simple system that you could adjust as needed. the suite has a never ending supply of furniture and storage cupboards aswell as washer/dryer, iron + board so you don't need to pack so much. included is a free safe in your room that you just programme with a pin number. The hotel service was great, maids clean everyday and bring fresh towels, bedding, toiletries etc... They even replenish the filter coffee daily so you can have a great cup of java whenever you like. for gods sake they even loaded the huge dishwasher and switched it on everyday for us, like i said AMAZING! Balcony was huge with chairs and tables and a lovely view over the lake, which pretty much every room had. Hotel staff were helpful and accomodating and they have staff to advise you on tickets, travel and places to go etc... such as the local supermarket just up the street. In addition we got menus for local food places pushed under our doors daily which we used to order in some nights and got them delivered to our doors. They have a large pool area with jacuzzi and kids pool + complimentary warm towels whenever you wanted them, so no trailing your room towels down to the pool. The only negative i have for lake eve was the buffet breakfast that you could buy for about $8 per head. It wasn't bad as such, just abit dull, However ,with the vast array of restaurants etc... on international drive this paled in comparison. i could go on and on about lake eve, but surfice to say that as a Brit, you will most definately not be disapointed. Any complaints about this place are from what i've seen abit petty and mostly made by the americans who are used to a much higher standard of service than us. Go, enjoy, hire a car and your holiday here will be AWESOME!!

Reviews.Title: “Blown away...two word review: "Huge Luxury"!”
Reviews.Author: LordStafford
Reviews.Content: Hello, I selected Lake Eve after doing a bit of online research and making a phone call, but was basically flying blind and taking a leap of faith. Well, I flew right into a bouquet of ROSES! This place is absolutely 5 star all the way. From when I drove up and the valet parked my car where I requested (near a side entrance), to the desk staff who had my keycard in my hands in mere minutes (they knew I had just driven 3 days to get there) to the cleaning staff who always met me with a smile and more toiletries and towels than I could ever use, the people were wonderful. The property...when I drove up (even thought I'd seen pictures), I was a bit overwhelmed! It is a large "U" shaped resort with the large pool, hot tub and courtyard in the middle, facing a lake where people paddle swan boats also facing town beyond the lake. I didn't use the pool or hot tub, but thoroughly enjoyed my A/C cooled room and whirlpool tub. (It was August, I was attending a convention and walked a lot outside!) Okay, enough about the building, what about the room/suite? Beyond my expectations. Now, I've travelled quite a bit, so I can be a bit picky. I've stayed at low priced hotels and expensive hotels, in Europe, the East Coast and most recently, LA, and I have NEVER stayed at any place that even approached the quality and value of Lake Eve. I knew this was a nice place, but nothing could prepare me for how HUGE this apartment (oh, I mean "suite" was). Since I had requested a room on the end on a high floor (12th), facing more straight towards the lake and town instead of the combo courtyard/lake views of the other rooms, it was quite a walk to get to the room with the view I requested from the elevator, but it was SO WORTH IT! After opening the door, there was a hallway. Turning right, I was delighted to find a large open plan "house" style layout, with a full sized kitchen with steel appliances (including dishwasher and microwave), granite countertop and island with bar seating, ALSO a full sized dining table and chairs. This area was tiled in high quality tile.
