Then more towards the end of the unit was the LARGE living area, with a long couch (which I think was also a bed), a loveseat, a large lounge chair, a coffee table, and a huge LCD TV. Of course this area was carpeted and beautifully decorated. Everything was of tasteful and high quality. At the end of the living room, nearly the entire wall was dominated by huge glass panes, one that slid open for access onto the balcony...talk about a view! (I got nightly fireworks displays from a nearby amusement park!) The balcony was huge (I'll be using that word a lot I think in this review!). It must have been at least 5 feet by 15 feet, and I'm probably underestimating. There also were four chairs and two small tables there. Since it was on the end and on the corner, you could also see down into the courtyard/pool area, but the main attraction was the stunning lake and views of town at night. Moving on inside, the maser bedroom (a separate room with its own door) was fit for a king. Of course there was a gigantic king sized beds , another big LCD TV, all the high quality linens and pillows you'd expect, all top notch, sophisticated and sleek design. (I normally don't care alot about that kind of stuff like interior design, but it was just so perfect it deserves mentioning!) The coup de grace was the master bathroom. A two sink granite countertop, a HUGE separate shower (at least 4 feet square) and a wonderful, big, separate whirlpool tub. THIS is what luxury hotels are made of. After long hot hours in the sweaty August weather, THIS was the place I went to sooth my muscles and my tired feet. Fantastic. Like they say on infomercials "but that's not all!". The suite I got also had essentially another wing! If you turned left after coming in the suite, there was ANOTHER huge separate bedroom with two large beds and another big LCD TV (for those of you keeping count, that's 3 flatscreens!). Across from it was a more basic bathroom, but with the same high quality materials. (Tub/shower combo, granite counter top). Other things I should mention is that there were closets EVERYWHERE, a washer dryer, a dishwasher (detergent provided), dishtowels, real dishes in a pantry close, and on and on. It was even extremely quiet! I thought I was the only one in my wing until I was checking out and met the people in the next suite! I chalk this quietness up to quality construction and insulation. It was silent with the windows closed. OH, I should mention that in the suites on the end, not only do you have the huge "wall of glass" where the balcony is, but windows also on all sides in each room (except the bathrooms). So you can enjoy all the Florida sun or use the blackout drapes to sleep in. A family could truly could live here comfortably and not be crowded. Move right in, they provide everything. The only thing you would need to bring is your clothes. Everything else was there. It's like home away from home (if your home is a luxury condo in a tropical paradise). If it sounds like I'm raving, it's because I am. I knew I was coming to a nice place, and there would be the expected amenities. I never expected the attention to detail, from towels folded into amazing animal shapes, the cleaning staff bringing more supplies than I could ever use, the spacious suite and luxurious outfitting of everything, and on and on. I am hoping to go see a rocket launch, and plan to stay here again. They have a person that arranges some excursions but I have not used that service yet. I got a pizza from the kitchen which was great, jbut I didn't use the pool area, I much preferred my nicely cooled A/C suite with whirlpool bath after a long sweaty day of walking. I recommend Lake Eve to all my family and friends, and would stay here even if it were an hour or so from where I actually was going (as in Cape Canaveral). It just makes the end of the day so peaceful and comfortable, which is important when you're away from home and need to be sharp for a meeting or want to be rested for your vacation. Love it! Can't wait to get back soon! (I don't give a "perfect" score lightly, I know travellers depend on others' reviews. For me, the location was fine with a "trolley" stop right across the street that went everywhere, so I could leave my car at the resort. Some may want to be more "right in the middle of things", I prefer to see the hubbub at a mile or so away and have my accomodations be a sanctuary at the end of the day, rather than having noise, cars and congestion all around me at one of the older type properties. So for me, it was a straight across perfect resort.)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous accommodation in great location”
Reviews.Author: MikeKirkcaldy
Reviews.Content: Looked at dozens of hotels around the Seaworld area - we knew we wanted to be at that end of I Drive, and got a great deal on a 2 bed apartment on the top floor for 15 nights in Oct 2010. Had read previous reviews on this hotel and there were a few that weren't great but the majority were very positive. All I can say to those who have posted negative reviews is that there just must be no pleasing some people - we couldn't fault the place. The apartment was superb -spotlessly clean with great facilties, a queen size bed in our room and two kings in the kids room. So many of the hotels in orlando seem to just have one big room with two queen beds in - it was important for us that our kids could have their own room, and this fitted the bill perfectly. Hotel staff were excellent whenever we needed them. Only slight criticism was that pool temperature seemed to be a bit inconsistent. Lovely location on I Drive - 5 mins to Seaworld and Aquatica, 10 mins to Disney parks and maybe 15 or so to Universal. Publix supermarket within walking distance was excellent and only a 2 minute drive to Premium outlets. Never tried the breakfast in the hotel - we just bought stuff from Publix and had breakfast in our room. We had an absolutely wonderful time and if we come back here in another 2 or 3 years we will definitely go back to Lake Eve as the accommodation and location were just superb. Would also consider other places around this area (Floridays or Sheraton Vistana etc), but we really feel that Lake Eve was excellent value for money and we would have to get an incredible deal to make us go anywhere else. First class.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: Margate_flDebbiec
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Room was clean and reasonablely priced. Check-in and out were efficent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: dra711
Reviews.Content: Resort was very nice. 2-bedroom suites were amazing: full kitchen, dining room with table, living room, 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, balcony, washer/dryer. Master bathroom was huge (jetted tub and separate tiled shower). 3 big screen TV's with nice channel selection. Didn't have to go get ice down the hall because refrigerator had water and ice dispenser. Large swimming pool with kiddie pool and hot tub. Free wi-fi was very fast. Not much of a business center (2 computers in the hallway). Charged for internet use, so went to room and used free wi-fi. We got a great last minute rate. Much cheaper than staying on Disney property. They have complimentary shuttle service to Epcot (3 times a day). Resort is not far from the Disney parks and Universal Studios. Many restaurants and grocery store close to hotel. Did not try hotel restaurant. We really enjoyed our stay. Great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to go bk again next year”
Reviews.Author: clare85Uk
Reviews.Content: we stayed here september 2010 for 2 weeks and are already planning our next trip next year we looked at the reviews before we went n was a bit unsure about going, but we looked at the pics n we fell in love with it so we booked. we were getting married 5 days after we arrived so we wanted a really nice hotel to be collected from. there was 9 of us travelling with 3 young children, we had 2 apartments they were huge our bathroom was gorgeous with a jacuzzi bath n big shower i did not want to leave its was beutiful. the reviews about the sun around the pool did not bother me as i had young children n didnt want them to be in the sun 2 long. i can honestly say i would never stay anywhere else i go to florida every year n this is the best hotel iv ever stayed in n i cannot wait to go bk next year thankyou lake eve for a wonderfull holiday and honeymoon i had a amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “the answer to my worries !”
Reviews.Author: lucygotmail
Reviews.Content: In june, my brother (11 years old) and i (22 years old) stayed at the lake eve resort for 7 nights for our Orlando trip. As my brother is very young and we're traveling without our parents, you can probably sense how worried i was about.. everything. The biggest concern and quality that i seek in a hotel was : shuttle bus transportation to all major theme parks, price of the hotel, and safe neighborhood/environment. Lake Eve had shuttle buses to the three major theme parks (disney, universal studios, sea world) every morning picking us up straight from the entrance. It was very convenient. I dont drive, so it was very important that the hotel had this service.( FOR FREE!) . theres also an itrolly stop right outside the gate of the resort. and just 2 stops from the PREMIUM OUTLET . (awesome for shopping) . we had to book a taxi to the PRIME OULET though since itrolly would mean traveling from one end to another .. ( time's very precious when traveling with minor). The room are more than what is described . we feel right at home, and since the resort is pretty new, so are the rooms. the bed was very comfortable. and their bathrooms are HUGE and fancy. im really picky with hotel bathrooms, always making sure i have my slippers on when im in there. but for lake eve, i can even go barefoot. (thats how clean and nice it looks). i can go on and go about my great experience there. its totally children friendly . but make sure u pack your own breakfast because the all the reviews on how bad the breakfast is at the restaurant is actually true. From desk was very helpful when we asked questions. Though there isnt much around the neighborhood, its realli peaceful and quiet. The only restuarant thats walkin distance was a Benihanas & dominos. overall, i very much enjoyed my time there and if i can go back again, id definitely choose the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new resort exactly as described.”
Reviews.Author: Carlisler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day trip from Orlando and we stayed at Lake Eve. The resort is brand new, the rooms are bid and comfortable. The bed is very comfortable, just what you need after a long day in the parks. The kitchen was well equipped, the only thing missing was a kettle, so we had to make do with using the water from the coffee maker for a cup of tea. To kake it really hot we just popped it in the microwave. The housekeeping was done everyday without fail. The flat screen tv's in both bedroom and lounge were very big especially in the lounge. The rooms we stayed in overllooked the swimming pool and the lake. The lounge had a balcony which was very handy if you want to just chill outside. There is also a fitness centre with a sauna to work off the huge meals in the nearby restaurants. There are supermarkets, pharmacies, malls, gas station all nearby and loads of restaurants. We had a car so I cannot comment on the I-drive bus, but we did see loads of them. All in all we were very satisfied with our choice compared with the problems we have had with loads of the well known resorts. We will definitely return there on our next trip to Orlando as the rates are very fair and the staff are very helpful. One further advantage is that you do not get hassled by timeshare salesmen. I would definitely recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and beautiful accomodations”
Reviews.Author: fodhis
Reviews.Content: Granite countertops, custom paint, jacuzzi, fully stocked kitchen, pool, located next to SeaWorld. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great value!”
Reviews.Author: alisander
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Travelocity's Secret Hotel deals and were a little anxious because we knew nothing about this hotel. We were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Beautiful hotel and room, great service and a perfect location for visiting all of the Orlando attractions. Just minutes from Disney, Universal and Sea World. Great restaurants and shops nearby. My only complaints were 1) the parking -- not enough for a full hotel; 2) no activities at the resort for the kids other than the pool. We had our vehicle, so transportation to the parks was not an issue for us. They do offer transporation, but it is very limited. Otherwise -- great place! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartment style hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynseyh75
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean and nicely decorated, full litchen with large american fridge. Shuttle to and from parks. Bed extremely comfortable. Views overlooking lake with fireworks views at night. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way! See you again in 2 years Lake Eve!”
Reviews.Author: mickyandnicky
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel in any way. Maid service was excellent - cleaned rooms thoroughly daily, changed towels and toiletries dailys and even done the dishes which was a nice surprise! Perfect location - quiet end of International Drive but not too far and for you none driving travellers, IRide stop 39 right outside the entrance, Orlando Premium Outlets and Publix right around the corner! Spacious rooms and excellent layout. Pool area and hotel in general was keep in excellent condition. All in all an amazing hotel to spend your Florida stay and will help you fall in love with the place as I and our group of 25 did!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, but some things do need to be looked in to”
Reviews.Author: S_smithOxford
Reviews.Content: Okay, Firstly I am British, so some will say we are easily pleased! Firstly there are things advertised on the website which are not available or open. The restaurant is only open for breakfast and there is no where to buy any lunch or dinner, so if you are having a relaxing day at the pool then you will need to make sure that you have been to the supermarket. Like someone previously stated there is a little room which sells crisps and some 'Pot Noodle' type snacks, but it is very limited. Also the baby pool is never open and the water is very cold. My 9 month old, screamed his head off when I tried to put him in it. Check in was first class, but then we were the only ones there in reception ! The room was out of this world and one of the nicest I have stayed in. You have a huge oven and microwave, plus a dish washer, washing machine and tumble dryer. The bathrooms are lovely and have plenty of towels. There was always hot water available and there were 3 huge tv's to, so you are spolit for choice. The room was cleaned everyday and if we needed anything, it was no problem. The downside, this resort is quite away from the hustle and bustle of International Drive, therefore we really needed our car. You can use the green I ride bus which is fantastic and very cheap and this pulls up and leaves right outside the hotel and will take you to all the restaurants. This stops at 10.30pm and can get quite busy. There was an incident when we were there which the hotel tried to cover up. We had gone to bed about 10.30pm and the next morning when we left our room we noticed all spray paint on our front door. When we walked around the flood we noticed that someone when we had gone to bed had vandalised our floor with spray paint and had painted graffiti symbols on the fire exit door, it had gone on the edge of the walls, the metal kick boards and on the carpet to. We reported it to reception and they looked very alarmed in deed and said that they weren't aware of any maintenance work going on and that they would check it out. We were very unsettled and some Americans remarked that the security should be upped. When we came back from the Theme park, the manager totally back tracked and said that everything was ok and it was the maintenance man! This was complete and utter rubbish and any idiot would be able to tell it was graffiti. What maintenance man goes around in the middle of the night marking doors he had to paint whith spray paint with zig zag's symbols and getting it all on the walls, fittings and carpets! He would be sacked on the spot. Also just at the end of our holiday while we were out for dinner, my Mum while baby sitting our son noticed youths skate boarding on the roof of the hotel! She honestly couldn't believe what she was seeing as we were on the top floor and yet again, how did they get up there? Despite the above I would stay at this hotel and I would recommend it to friends. I just think that perhaps the security needs to be upped a bit and the website should state that the restaurant and pool bar are not open out of season.

Reviews.Title: “Bed, bath and kitchen sink”
Reviews.Author: PeggyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Lake Eve Resort in Orlando, Florida Pros: -Very Clean -Suite had living room, dining room, beautiful kitchen, bathroom and bedroom -Very attractive -Warm and wonderful pool -Hot tub -Desk staff was very nice -Suite had balcony which faced the pool and lake -Located on International Drive so was easy to drive to Universal (6 miles away) and Orange County Convention Center (4 miles away) -About 4 miles from Downtown Disney Cons: -Terrible smell of glue in hallway on the second floor which was our floor and housed the maintenance staff "office" -Breakfast buffet was $5.95, but was not very good -The Bars at the pool and in restaurant never opened during our week stay so don't think that you will be poolside with an umbrella drink in your hand -Little store near lobby sold food items for prices four times as much as a grocery store so try to not buy anything there Advice: -All in all, it was a wonderful place to stay -Go to Publix on Vineland Avenue which is a short drive (you could walk) and buy breakfast foods so you are ready to hit the Theme Parks with energy

Reviews.Title: “Cheaply built to be honest...and cheaply maintained.”
Reviews.Author: hizzys
Reviews.Content: Upon walking into my room i thought i had a gotten a very nice deal. The place looks very nice on first glance. Then you go to sit down and notice how stiff the living room furniture is. You go to the bathroom, and find that they use near sandpaper grade quality toilet paper as well as facial tissue. You try and flush the toilet after your daily business and it takes 3-4 times before it goes away (and im not talking large business either). You go to take a shower and find that the shower turns off 2-3 times by itself when you are talking a shower. I went outside to drive my car and upon returning find a used condom in my parking space (i couldn't possibly make this up). And finally, when you want to sleep you really find out how cheaply built the place is by all the sounds coming through the paper thin walls! Man was it very very disturbing. I wish i could find a single night where i didn't hear very loud noises. This should not be in a 2 year old hotel!!! 2 stars for the price i paid (which if you are paying over $100 your getting ripped off) and for the location, but not much more. Internet was spotty at best and you pay a resort fee of $7.50 for it daily whether or not you get to use it. Most people are shocked by paying the additional resort fee at the end but there is a notice before you get your room in the lobby. I would not recommend this hotel, and won't be staying there again. I can see why it's the 45th rated hotel in Orlando and falling. Im sure the management will try and write an apology under this review, but save it cause everything i have written is 100% true.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, with a costly sting at the end...”
Reviews.Author: Nostaw
Reviews.Content: we stayed here at the end of august 2010 for 2 weeks. this hotel is perfect, rooms are excellent and so is the location! new clean hotel close to everything. on check in you are asked to give your credit card details incase of room damage etc, $100 will be debited then returned at the end of the stay if everthing is ok. which it was. on check out i was given a receipt and i noticed a 'resort fee' charge + tax with my credit card at the bottom with $100 dollers next to it. i thought the $100 was being returned to my card and the 'resort fee' was included in my prepaid rate. the total at the bottom of the page was $0.00. turns out this was not the case! turns out they had charged my card this resort fee per day with out authorization, i did not sign anything. currently i am speaking to expedia and my bank who both think these actions are fraudulent. so please watch out for this stealth surcharge at the end of your stay. this is such a shame as this hotel is really good but left us with a sour taste. add about £80 to your total stay as this is roughly what it amounts to (exchange rate depending)

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: auldred
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks on the 14th floor, and received excellent service from polite and informative staff. The 2 bedroomed apartment was clean,spacious, comfortable, and well appointed ,with a beautiful view. Centrally located, it was handy for supermarket(Publix), Outlet Mall(Premier), Restaurants ,and of course the Parks. The Trolleyline came in handy a few times too.The hotel amenities were very good (pool,fitness centre etc).Provision of electric jug/kettle would have been appreciated for cups of tea(,a coffee perc is provided ). The large screen LCD TV's in each room were well used.All in all a very very comfortable and enjoyable stay. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, would return!”
Reviews.Author: Sammy60766
Reviews.Content: Very clean and spacious suite, we loved having a washer and dryer. They have a safe in the bedroom closet where we left the laptop and any other valuables. The fridge freezer gave us ice and water. There is a hairdryer in the bathroom and an iron and board in the bedroom. The beds were very comfortable and all bedding fresh and clean! Free internet and flat screen tv's. Great stay, friendly staff. Close to Sea World and shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: adnaval
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Orlando, Florida five days prior to our cruise so we could visit Disneyworld and Universal Studios. We used MH Transportation to get us from the airport to Lake Eve Resort on International Drive. The driver met us by the baggage pick-up and allowed us a 1/2 hour stop at a local grocery store. I would recommend this transportation company. We didn't find the need to rent a car as tranportation was so easy from the hotel and we had all the groceries we needed before we even checked in. Lake Eve Resort was absolutely perfect. Not only was it gorgeous inside and out, but it provided all the amenities of staying in a condo. Some of the perks were the full size & stocked kitchen (w/dishwasher), stacked washer and dryer, Jacuzzi tub, balcony, and free shuttle to the theme parks. We booked the one bedroom suite and there was plenty of room for the four of us. We stayed on the 14th floor...amazing views! Tip - Freeze water bottles for the theme parks. This will save you tons of $$$. We took turns carrying the backpack. Also, I wanted to mention that the I-Trolley Ride is only $1.25 each way and you can even buy day passes. This trolley goes all the way down both sides of International Drive where there is tons of shopping, dining, and entertainmet. We didn't use the free hotel shuttle to get to Universal as the pick up/drop off times weren't ideal. The I-trolley worked perfectly. Universal is about a 10 minutes walk from the stop. Easy. We did use the shuttle to and from Disneyword and we have no complaints. Our teens loved the pool and hot tub and used it as much as time allowed. We didn't use the restaurant at the hotel because we bought so many groceries but buffet breakfast was only $5.95 if you booked it the night before. I highly recommend Lake Eve Resort. I won't stay anywhere else the next time we visit Orlanda!

Reviews.Title: “brill”
Reviews.Author: MORCAMBE
Reviews.Content: just arrived home , had a great time fantastic hotel very friendly staff , wil be going back

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC, AMAZING ROOMS, GREAT LOCATION - 5 *****”
Reviews.Author: Natasha070
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel back in February for our summer holiday with three children to Disney - as we wanted to be near Seaworld and Aquatica primarily this was an ideal location as we had no car and the I - Ride caught outside the hotel was direct and only 5 stops - although you have to cross a very busy road. We loved this hotel - the room was a fantastic home from home -with enough space for all of us to spread out - being a big family we all had our own large screen tv - the washer dryer was a handy addition and the best of all was the fully stocked kitchen including dishwasher that the maid loaded ! We had fresh coffee every morning a beautifully cleaned room everyday, the pool was basic but enough after a hot day around the parks and a good way for the children to meet friends. I would certainly stay at this hotel again I only wish I had a chance to let the manager know in person what a great hotel he is running - if I was going to give a negative it would be that the restaurant could have been a little bit more inviting. We had dinner there our first night which was not great and breakfast a couple of times but overall it was easier to eat in the room or out as you have an array of restaurants on International Drive and the hotel is right near a major supermarket. I checked Trip Advisor every week before we stayed here and valued the comments as it builds up a picture of your holiday and is invaluable when planning - especially as with three children of varying ages this is a holiday you certainly need to plan for. Thank you to Lake Eve for contributing to our holiday being such a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “massive rooms”
Reviews.Author: mmckmwb
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel in may of this year. large 2 bed apartment, 4 beds, 3tv's washer and dryer and two bathrooms. Better rooms than the vistana villages across the road but at a cheaper price. No problem parking during our 14 night stay. Out of Vistana Villages/hilton grand vacations i drive/fairfield inn/point orlando resort over the years this place has been the best rooms and best value for money. There may not be entertainment during the day like other hotels but the rooms make up for this....The only issue I had is that the lights were always on in every location during the day. each morning in the gym all the lights were on and the tv and the air con but there was no one there. Not to save the planet but it must cost a fortune and surely the hotel can cut some costs and pass these cuts onto guests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Friendly Staff, Room Poorly Maintained”
Reviews.Author: CrimsonnWhite93
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family for one night following a 7 day cruise. I chose this hotel because it offered a 3 room suite (at a good price) which would easily accommodate 5 people providing us with a full kitchen, laundry, whirlpool tub and plenty of space for everyone to spread out and relax before returning home. It was also fairly close to the airport and Universal Studios. We arrived early, but we could not check in early because the hotel had been full the night before. However, the staff was kind enough to store our luggage, allowing us to leave and do a bit of shopping. They even delivered our luggage to our room after we checked in. The hotel is beautiful and is in a great location. We initially found the room to be beautiful and spacious with a great view. Unfortunately, over the next few hours we discovered so many problems with our room, that it took away from our ability to completely enjoy our stay. I am not a complainer by nature, and I expect hotel rooms to exhibit “normal wear and tear; however, there were just too many problems with our room for me to overlook. First, the door to our room would not open unless you shoved it open with your shoulder. Then, you had to shove it with your shoulder and slam it in order for it to close. When I examined the door closely from the outside, I noticed that it was cracked on two sides and looked as though someone had tried to break the door down at one time. Due to the condition of the door, the deadbolt would not lock which left me feeling a little uneasy. When my mom opened the dishwasher it was full of water. She called the front desk and they sent up a maintenance man. He brought a wet vac and sucked the water out, but told us that the dishwasher was broken and could not be used until a part had been replaced. The light above the whirlpool tub did not work and one of the lights in the kitchen, one of lights in the queen bedroom and one of the lights in the master bedroom appeared to have a short as they would go off for long periods of time before coming back on. At one point, I thought the power had gone out, except that other lights were working. Our room had four televisions -one in the living room and one in each bedroom. The television in the queen bedroom had bad reception and some of the color stations only played in black and white. In the same bedroom, one of the queen beds was broken and had separated from the wall. On the wall near the 2nd queen bed there were smears which looked a lot like blood. The chair in the king bedroom (not the master bedroom) had a broken leg which had been propped up under the chair and fell off when my father went to move it. The dryer worked well, but water temperature for the washer only allowed you to wash in hot water and warm water. The cold water was not cold. The ironing board appeared to be broken as well. Still, the worst thing about our room was the water. When I filled a glass with water from the sink, I had taken only one small sip before I had to spit it out. Then, I noticed the odor. It was awful! There was a strong chemical, burning smell. My father commented on it as well. We are all water drinkers, but it was so bad that none of us could drink it. There was no bottled water in the small store downstairs, and I finally ended up ordering two bottles when I ordered pizza from a local restaurant. I had looked forward to using the whirlpool tub, but when I filled the tub with water, all you could smell was the same awful, chemical odor. The smell of the water was so bad that it overpowered any soaps and bath oils that I put in the water. I was hesitant to even bath in the water for fear of what it might do to my skin. I used some of the bottle water to brush my teeth because I could not stand the thought of putting any of that water in my mouth. I called the front desk staff and reported all of these problems. The lady at the desk was extremely nice and said that she would note the time of my call and the complaints about the room so that we would not be held responsible for its condition. Upon, checkout, I also left a written list, outlining some of our complaints. The gentleman at the desk was very nice. He apologized for the condition of the room and said that he would pass along our problems to maintenance. Despite our experience, we liked the hotel and my family even commented that they would like to come and stay for about a week if the room was in better condition. All of the staff were wonderful and tried to be helpful. I have no way of knowing if we just happened to receive a room with lots of problems or if the problems we encountered are common to most of the rooms in the hotel. However, I just do not feel that I can honestly recommend this hotel to others until I am sure that the problems in our room are addressed and that others won’t have a similar experience. As much as I liked the hotel itself and the staff, I would not have stayed more than one night in this room in its current condition. I hope that these problems are addressed because, as I stated before, this is a beautiful hotel, I would like to stay here again---in a room that has been better maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews! It was Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: J_anderson19578
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Orlando year after year and always trying new resorts to try out! Lake Eve was way beyond our expectations. The rooms were spotless and very luxurious! They do charge a resort fee, we had no problem paying that since they offered free wireless internet, valet parking and free shuttle service to Walt Disney World! This resort was centrally located to all of Orlando's great attractions. We loved the breakfast buffet at the restaurant every morning, it was very inexpensive but high quality food. The staff was extremely knowledgeable and helpful with all of our questions and needs. The beds were very comfortable, which was very important after having been at the parks all day with the kids! The pool was great, but it is a shame that the pool bar is only open on the weekends! Lake Eve is a newer resort that we hadn't heard of and we actually found it online through Orlando Savings. We called them and they helped plan our trip and also got us some discount tickets to Disney World. The kids enjoyed everything, and I enjoyed saving money on our trip. We will definitely be staying at Lake Eve on your next trip to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “False advertising to start with...”
Reviews.Author: Hotellover70
Reviews.Content: We booked this vacation through Travelocity and got a great rate for our four night vacation. I spent extensive time looking over the Lake Eve resort website and reading the reviews prior to making my final decision. The pictures of the resort were representative of the actual thing. However, the floor plans and description of beds in each unit were not. Their website states each unit has a king size bed in the master bedroom and two queens in the second bedroom. There is no disclaimer that this may vary by room. We checked into the hotel and went to our room. The first thing we saw was that according to the sign on the door we had been given a handicapped room. We went in anyway and headed straight to the bedrooms to set our luggage down. Instead of two queens in the second bedroom we found one king. Based on the relationships and genders we were traveling with this was absolutely not going to work. We turned right around and headed back to the desk to ask for a room as advertised. We were told there was nothing they could do as the hotel was sold out and that they could not give that room to someone else as we had now "dirtied it". We were also told that we wanted a two bedroom and we got a two bedroom and that our room was capable of sleeping 8 people - 3 in each king and two on the double sized pull out sofa. I explained that if it had been our desire that someone sleep in the living room, we would not have looked for the two queen beds. I was also curious to know which couple they expected to have a third person in their bed. We were told that the best they could do was try to change us the next day if someone checked out but that they did not think it possible. We asked to speak to the manager but the young lady at the desk said she was all that was available. We then asked for a number of someone to talk with and she gave us the general managers business card and stated he would be available in the morning. We went up to our room and then realized the second tub had a bench installed to be handicapped friendly which limited our use. We then called Travelocity and explained the situation. The agent there heard us out and then looked at the Lake Eve resort website. She sided with us agreeing that the site says all two bedroom suites have two queen sized beds in the extra room. She then called the hotel and talked with them and then told us the hotel had agreed to change our room in the morning. We did not understand why they would not change it then as according to their site, they still had rooms available. Late that evening we went to pull the sofa sleeper open and discovered that the metal frame supporting the mattress was completely cracked in half and unusable. We called the front desk who sent up the maintenance man. He kept apologizing over and over while telling us it wasn't fixable and had no other solutions. He also said that the desk was not going to switch our room that night but that they would in the morning. We again talked the desk who told us if we left, they would charge us a two night penalty. We did our best to sleep that night with one person on the closed couch. The beds were unbearably hard and uncomfortable and one of us who has a bad back was in tears when we were woken up at 5:30 by the telephone ringing. It rang 3 times and when we answered no one was there. We called the front desk and they stated it was not them but offered to send maintenance up again. At this point we were done. We went online and looked for another place to stay. Thank God for Marriott who said we could come over right away and that we could even eat at the free breakfast buffet. By then it was about 7:30 in the morning and the assistant manager was there. He agreed we could leave and pay for only the one night. He did, however, charge us the reort fee. The ironic part was that of the benefits of the resort fee, the only one we got to use was the free Internet, which we used to find a new hotel. We never had a chance to use the pool or anything else due to our multiple discussions with Travelocity and the front desk. We called Travelocity and they then spoke to the front desk to confirm we did not have to pay for more than one night and promised to refund our money. We then headed to the Marriott where we had breakfast and then all laid down to get some sleep. This is a beautiful hotel. It had a wonderful looking pool and the suite was very pretty. However, as the saying goes "All that glitters is not gold". Incidently, if the suite was for 8, then why were there only 5 plates, 6 glasses, 6 bowls, 4 forks, etc?

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, HORRIBLE service!!!”
Reviews.Author: abell79
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent the whole week there to go to the parks at Disney World. I was impressed by the 2 bedroom suite. Very nice and great location! But, the customer service personell were totally rediculous and rude!! The maid service was horrible! The maids took the trash out of the kitchen area and left them in the bathroom and bedrooms. They didn't leave any towels and did not clean the rooms or make-up the beds. Also, the lobby restaurant closed 2 hours earlier than when it was supposed to. We asked the front desk clerk, and she said that she didn't know why they closed early. I would not recommend this hotel simply because the customer service was one of the worst!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Apartments - Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: hertfordshire4
Reviews.Content: Well here I go. I will try to give an honest review of the hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroomed apartment on the eleventh floor in end of May/June 2010. Views were great for the fireworks at SeaWorld in the evening. We travelled with a 9 year old boy husband and wife. The apartment Overall Excellent. 2 bedrooms one with queen size bed and ensuite bathroom with Jacuzzi bath and walk in shower other room 2 king size beds with ensuite bath and shower over bath. Plenty of clean towels and toiletries replenished 6 days not Sundays. Lounge with sofa, chair and coffee table. Large flat screen TV with lots of channels to choose from. Kitchen was well equipped with modern American Fridge/Freezer with ice maker, Microwave, oven, grill, waste disposal, toaster, coffee making machine with sachets provided. There was a dishwasher which was loaded by the maid if needed and detergent replenished daily. There was also a dining area which seated 6 and a huge washing machine and dryer. You needed to buy your own detergent. There is also an iron and ironing board. Home from home in my opinion. Large balcony with 2 chairs and small table. The apartment was serviced daily – the maid would remove rubbish, tidy kitchen, make beds, clean bathrooms and replenish towels. I'm not sure that they cleaned daily but we didn't really make a mess was very satisfied with the cleanliness of the apartment. Hotel in General There is an outdoor swimming pool with limited sunbeds and a bar that was only open at weekends. Free pool towels were provided. It is open until 10.00pm but there were children in there later than that. As long as you shut your patio doors you couldn't hear them. Not the best pool for sunbathing as limited sun but warm enough to have a refreshing dip. There was also a hot tub which was great to soak your weary body after long days walking round the parks. If you want a relaxing day of sunbathing go to Aquatica and lay on the beach there. The communal areas of the hotel were clean. The lift is very slow and takes a while to get you to the 11th Floor. Never had to wait too long though when calling a lift. There is a very small indoor gym with a sauna which we used once but don't expect state of the art equipment very basic. Reception is not staffed all the time and there is a very helpful concierge who will help you book tickets give you directions etc. There was a restaurant there but never saw it open along with a small shop. There is internet access but never saw anyone on it. At weekends there is valet parking run by very polite young lads who looked after us very well. We only tipped them on the last night but they still gave us excellent service. Surrounding Area The hotel is situated at the quiet end of International Drive which is fine as you normally drive everywhere anyway. It is well located for SeaWorld and Aquatica being only 5 minutes away and Disney parks are about 20 minutes. There is a large Publix supermarket (turn right out of the hotel) which stocks everything you will need. There is also a Subway there and behind it is a great family restaurant called Outback which we found to be very good value with good service. It is an Australian BBQ which serves good ribs, steaks etc. The Olive Tree on International Drive was also a very good restaurant. Nice Italian food with great service and again good value for money. If you want to eat cheaply then go to Sizzlers which is a buffet restaurant costing $10.99 for adults as much as you can eat salad, meats, fruits, Mexican, and deserts. We found Wet n Wild to be really busy and not very well managed with long queues. Aquatica was by far the better water park. We chose SeaWorld to view fireworks but the Disney parks do displays as well but we decided once you've seen one show there all much of a muchness. There is a Premier Outlook Mall near to the hotel (turn right out of hotel). Visit the concierge for money off coupons before you go. Summary This was a great choice for us travelling with a 9 year old. The apartments are of a very high standard, large and very comfortable. If you want to stay at the hotel during the day then this isn't geared for that but for using as a base to visit the attractions in Orlando it was fantastic. Would definitely recommend it. Better than Quality Inn's or Days Inn's that we've stayed at previously. Accommodation 4 star overall amenities 2/3 star. It makes a great place to stay with the facilities to cater for yourselves if you want to. We found that at weekends it was much busier a lot of Americans use it as a base which is a good advertisement as they are generally very fussy. We always found all the staff pleasant, friendly and polite. There is no food in the hotel but you do get lots of Pizza leaflets through your door. I know I've gone on but I hope you've found this information useful. I have tried to be honest in my report as I always check out the hotel before we go and have found other reviews to be unhelpful

Reviews.Title: “Bit by Bugs during stay - Don't stay in Room 606”
Reviews.Author: bit_by_bugs
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Lake Eve Room 606 from Jun 26 to July 4, 2010 for eight days. Overall I can not be satisfied by the service and facilities. 1. There is no fill-up of sanitary supplies during stay. We have to call the management for toilet papers twice. 2. During the eight days, nobody cleaned kitchen and we will have to do all the dishwashing and cleaning of the countertop. 3. There is a restaurant but serving breakfast buffet like super 8 with 5.99 per head. 4. There is a so-called gym but I did not see any guest using that simply because this is so shabby. 5. Worst thing is that we got bed bug bites. Three of my party guests were bit and all had the same symptom. We escalated this again to the resort management after return and diagnozed by different doctors. There is no reply, nor apologies. That makes Lake Eve the worst hotel I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “High quality accomodation in a good location”
Reviews.Author: UKTonyJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lake Eve Resort in July 2010. We had a 2-bedroomed apartment which was very spacious. Master bedroom had a super king-size bed, and a huge bathroom with 2 basins, spa bath and double shower. Clean towels etc. each day. Twin bedroom had 2 queen-sized beds, with a separate bathroom with bath, shower etc. Kitchen was very well equipped with new appliances (range cooker, microwave, fridge freezer, dishwaher etc.). Lounge area had seating for 3 (my only gripe - perhaps another chair should be provided). Dining area had a large dining table suitable for 6. The hotel is situated about a mile south of SeaWorld, and about 10 minutes away from Disney and 15 from Universal (by car). I think the hotel puts on a shuttle bus, but we did not use it. It's in a quiet, almost residential area, which suited us. There's a big supermarket about 2 mins away by car whioch stocked everything you could need. We did not use the restaurant, but I would have expected it to be good. Overall, it is excellent accommodation, which looks very new. We have stayed in other similar properries before (2 bedroomed apartments) and this is easily the best. Booked it through Thomson in the UK. Thoroughly recommend it to others. Hopefully we'll go to Orlando again in a couple of years, and will certainly choose here to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel. Great for families. Loved it! Loved it!! Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunlighter
Reviews.Content: We live a couple of hours away from Orlando. We visit and stay at different resorts in Orlando a few times a year. We have stayed at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge, Carribean Beach Resort, Port Orleans, camp grounds, Nick hotel, time shares,etc... But, at the end of this vacation my husband said Lake Eve Resort was by far the best hotel for extended or long week vacations. We stayed at Lake Eve Resort the week of July 5th through the 9th, 2010. We were 6 altogether, 4 kids (ages 5, 7, 9 and 10). We had an awesome time. The hotel was beautiful, the rooms were spacious and clean (exactly like the pictures on their website). We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. The kitchen and bathrooms were spotless (I use to work for a hotel and that is always the first thing I checked, along with the sheets, etc...) We originally picked the hotel because it is minutes away from Sea World, the kids were in Sea World Summer Camp for a week and we choose the hotel because of the full kicthen. I must say it turned out to be the best thing ever. Aside from the fact that we were able to make our own meals and save money, we were able to refrigerate fruits and healthy snacks for the kids. (Kitchen fully equipped with plates, silverware, pots and pans, strainer, cooking utensils) The rooms are spacious and have lots of storage and closet space. Another big plus was the washer and dryer. I washed the kids clothes everyday. This was the first trip were I came home with a bag full of clean clothes rather than having a pile to wash. The housekeeping staff were very curteous. They came in everyday, emptied the trash, started the dishwasher for us, cleaned up a bit. Overall very good job. The front desk staff were very helpful and quite attentive. They hotel has a large pool (No need to bring pool towels, the hotel has them available by the pool). There is also spa and a kiddie pool. Our kids had a blast. The hotel has a small gym with a sauna, restaurant and a very small shop for essentials. As far as parking, I had read other people's review and we did not have the same experience. The hotel was fully booked, but parking was available. They offer complimentary valet at no charge or you can self park. Overall, I loved the hotel!!! Lots of families with small kids. Yes we could hear some of the guests walking around above our room, but hey with 4 kids of my own I know that the guests below us must have heard my kids running around and having a great time in our suite. Our suite was great. We all felt at home. It was so clean that I felt comfortable enough to allow my kids to walk barefoot in the suite. We stayed on the 12th floor overlooking the pool. Every suite has either a view of the pool or for an upgrade a view of the lake. We loved it so much. We have already told our friends and we are already planning to come back next year (the kids will be attending Sea World Summer Camp again). Great place!! We loved it so much, we called friends during our trip and told them all about it. Maybe next year we will share a 3 bedroom suite. The hotel rate was excellent! I booked it back last December thought hotel.com for $109 plus tax per night. You can't beat the price. Yes once you check out you are charged about $8 bucks a night for the resort fee. Did not mind the charge since the room rate was so low. Spoke to the mgr, the hotel has only been opened for 1 yr and 2 months. Great Hotel!! Recommend it to all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: jofromni
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks with my family of four. We stayed in a two bedroomed suite which was really spacious and comfortable. i loved the fact that there was a washer and dryer in the suite as it meant i didnt have to bring any dirty clothes home. Room service was excellent, they came every day to change towels, make beds and wash any dishes that you hadnt got round to doing, every three days they changed the beds and gave the suite a thorough clean. The pool here was lovely and clean and a good size, there is also a poolside bar which is handy and the only downside is that bar only opens for a few hours. This resort is located at the quieter end of International Drive which suited me, however the I Ride stop is just outside the resort and you never have to wait long untill the next bus comes. I really enjoyed my stay here and would most definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ryanjulia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The room was very nice and spacious. We stayed in a 2 bedroom room and it had a full kitchen and nice balcony. Very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: PatB_57
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 5 nights at this hotel. We had the three bedroom suite. The rooms are very spacious. After walking around Disney and Universal all day, the beds felt like heaven. We really appreciated the full kitchen. We cooked several of our meals in it. (Saved a lot of money this way). The bathrooms were clean and spacious. Also, for a hotel this size, it was quiet. The only complaint I have (and it is minor), is the internet could not go any slower. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely property, lacking amenities”
Reviews.Author: linditchka
Reviews.Content: The property, and the suites are lovely, however make a stop at a supermarket before checking in. The shop to purchase groceries is VERY limited, and room service is not available 24 hours a day. The resorts shuttle service to the parks is lacking. The service is very limited, no shuttles to Animal Kingdom, or Hollywood Studios. You have to take the shuttle to either the Magic Kingdom or Epcot and then take Disney transportation between parks. We took the shuttle back from Epcot at 9:45pm (the only one offered in the evening) it then went to the Magic Kingdom for a 10pm pick up and did not arrive back at Lake Eve until 10:50 pm. An hour and 5 minutes for a 20 minute ride was quite excessive. Overall would stay here again but not unless I rent a car

Reviews.Title: “Great place to call home”
Reviews.Author: TexasMama26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lake Eve resort for 6 nights. We loved it. The rooms were very comfortable. We loved having a kitchen. They were equipped with every you would need to make a meal. I was able to make breakfast every morning before heading out to the parks for the day. This saved us a lot of money as we could hold off eating lunch until 2 most days. I loved the washer and dryer in the room suite. It was nice to come home from vacation with all of our laundry done. The maid service was a little hit and miss but over all not bad. This is a great place to stay if you are looking for a quiet, well priced base while in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!”
Reviews.Author: ruddwallacefan
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid for the room (less than $100 per night) I was not expecting much, but I was pleasantly suprised. The front desk staff was very nice. The 1 bedroom unit we stayed in was spacious and clean. The housekeeping was WONDERFUL!!!! Because we were only staying there 3 nights and figured we didn't need housekeeping, we left the do not disturb sign on the door. EACH DAY when we returned to our room we had a bag left at the door with clean towels, wash clothes, soap, toilet paper, shampoo and lotion. We were so impressed by this since prior to our stay at Lake Eve Resort we had just checked out of a 4 star resort that didnt provide any of those items. The only thing that I feel needs improvement would be to the pool. When we visited the pool there were quite a few bugs and leaves floating around. Regardless, I would stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: foreverdelayed82
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a few reasons - the main ones being it was a very good price, the rooms were in the style of an apartment with a washing machine and dryer, oven, microwave, dishwasher etc, there was a shuttle bus to the theme parks (Epcot and Universal Studios), and from other reviews the hotel appeared to be quite new so the rooms looked to be nice and clean. First of the all, the rooms were of a good standard. We got upgraded so I am not sure of the size of the regular rooms, but ours was very spacious and clean. Also if you can get a room that is on a higher floor, you will most likely have a nice view. There were also all the appliances I mention above, although we didn't feel the need to cook in the room. The pool was also good, although we didn't use it much at all, but there were always towels available and there was a smaller section for younger children. The shuttle bus was not great. In terms of not having to bother with hiring a car, it was beneficial, but the bus itself was probably one of the oldest, most rickety buses known to man, and we didn't particularly appreciate the fact that there were posters everywhere on the inside of the bus saying how great and important tips are to healthy drivers (the implication being that if we didn't tip then our drivers' health would suffer!). Also I would check the times of the shuttle bus beforehand, because when we went there were only a few per day, in the morning and the evening, so if you wanted to come back early in the afternoon for a swim, then you would have to find your own way. In addition to this, the shuttle bus stops at a few hotels on the way to the parks, so it could sometimes take the best part of an hour to get there. The hotel is located on International Drive South, which was not actually all that clear to us when we booked. It is a bit further away from the hustle and bustle of International Drive then we would have liked, but it's not the worst location to be in. It sits on Lake Eve and as I said before, there are some nice views to be had. There is a supermarket which is about 15 minutes walk away, and there is also a Domino's Pizza about 5 minutes away. Apart from that, there isn't much nearby. I wouldn't recommend the hotel restaurant, we ate breakfast there on the first morning and the food wasn't too bad, but the hotel is a 'cashless' hotel, so they bill everything to your room, which means they add on tips and various charges at their own free will. When we arrived there was a poster on the fridge door advertising a pizza from the restaurant, delivered to your room for $9.95. We were tired and so we thought we would give it a try, but I ended up getting a bill for over $16 because they not only added on a delivery charge of $3, but they added on a tip of about 20% as well. Also, the pizza was one of the worst I have ever tasted. So essentially, if you are not going to stay at the theme parks all day and eat your dinner there, then you are better heading up International Drive and trying out the plethora of restaurants there. We often did this and the choice seemed endless. The one thing which did really annoy me about the hotel was that when we checked out we had to pay a 'Resort Fee' of $7.50 + tax per day. Having booked through lastminute.com, we were told that our booking had been fully pre-paid and that the hotel were not to charge us, but on our day of check out we received a bill for over $100 which we had not expected. This fee, by the way, was apparently to cover the shuttle bus to the parks, maintenance of the pool etc etc - which begs the question, why doesn't the room charge cover this? I raised this with the hotel and their response was that lastminute would not be able to charge us for this because it is a resort fee and lastminute have nothing to do with it. So essentially they sell very cheap rooms to lastminute.com, people book them thinking they are getting a good deal, and then the hotel adds on an extra charge to guarantee a bit of extra money from the customer to cover them selling the room really cheap. I believe a lot of hotels in Orlando do this kind of thing. Although this review has not been great, the hotel actually wasn't bad, and the staff were ok for the most part as well. We probably wouldn't go back, but this is because we know the area better now. It was good at the time of booking because it was pretty much self catering and had the shuttle bus to the parks - which was what we were looking for. Definitely not the worst place in the world though.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT! Beautiful large suites, quiet location, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: gomom
Reviews.Content: Our trip was a spur-of -the-moment decision, and my usual exhaustive research was cut short--as a former travel consultant, I enjoy the planning. I love a deal, and I want as much information as I can get. I found Lake Eve, found an incredible rate and thought, "What's the catch?" The reviews (thank you, TripAdvisor!) were good, and we decided to go for it. and guess what?! There's no catch! It's a wonderful property! I reserved a 2br/2ba suite for 4 of our family (hubby, 2 college kids, & me) and all I can say is, "WOW!!" Our suite was awesome! It was gi-normous, and we loved everything about it---the quiet location (but an easy drive to both WDW & Universal parks, & very close to SeaWorld), the view (lake, pool, evening fireworks from SeaWorld), great beds and flat screen tv in each bedroom, large living area with large flat screen tv, upscale details (granite counter in kitchen and both baths, master bath had jacuzzi tub and separate shower), and a fully equipped kitchen. The staff was courteous and helpful, the pool area is pretty, and everything was clean and well-maintained. We would stay here again in a heartbeat, even at a much higher rate. It's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: Alexa015
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for in these tough times. The staff at Lake Eve was rude and when trying to speak to the manager was given the run around. No one returned my calls. The fitness center is a joke. We had to pay to use the computer in the common area. Every day we would come home to find pizza fliers on our floor that someone put under the door. Very unprofessional for a hotel. I would say to anyone...don't stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Would only stay here from now on.”
Reviews.Author: webtravelreview
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. We got it through Hot Wire. The location is perfect for many places. We were there pre-cruise and decided to spend some time at Sea World. Sea World was an easy 5 minute drive. The second day we used the complimentary shuttle which also worked very well. We are always leary of shuttle b'c we don't want to spend precious vacation time waiting. But it really was perfect. Dropped off and picked up right in front of resort. The room we had was huge. We have 2 kids, they each had their own queen bed and their own bathroom. The master had a king and a huge bathroom. The living space was nice. The kitchen was also really nice. We cooked breakfast and had snacks but you could really make all of your meals here. We have stayed on Property at Disney for 3x the cost and a fraction of the space. It would not be worth it to me again. I would always stay here. There were several groups with schools and I worried about the noise, but we really didn't hear much. The pool was nice. Very refreshing for hot May days. The staff was fine, not overly friendly or helpful but fine.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and good for long stays. Nice location!”
Reviews.Author: diamond_6irl
Reviews.Content: Our experience in this resort was good after all. My boyfriend and I went to Orlando for 5 days, reserved the one bedroom suite but when we got there found out there wasnt rooms available, so they gave us the two bedroom suite for handicaped. It wasnt bad, but they should have a better organization with reservations, so be aware. Rooms are spacious and clean, except for towels. I found out an old red stain in one of my "clean" towels. It was really disgusting to see that, so be aware too. Room decor is ok, nothing too fancy but better than average rooms. It will probably remind you home. Our room had everything you might need to survive for 5 days in Orlando. Full equiped kitchen, oven, microwave, fridge, cutlery, wash disher, washer and dryer, flat tv in each room and living room. I wish they would've had dvd player or ihome though. It would've been cool. The only thing i didnt like was that walls are really thin, i could hear our neighbors flushing the toilet and dropping stuff. However, I think this is one of the best options you have if youre going to WDW and dont want to stay at a Disney Resort. This place is all about location. Everything is so close, 15-20 mins from airport, 10 mins to Orlando Premium Outlets, 20 mins to Universal Studios and WD Parks. Even though everything is close i strongly recomend you to rent a car. There are also many restaurants nearby. Walgreens is around the corner and this supermarket Publix is also next to it. You can go there to do grocery shopping. It is really a good and convenient place for families to stay for a long time. Just make sure to bring your own towels :)

Reviews.Title: “AKA Trump Towers!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mel3005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for seven nights after visiting the gulf coast. E-mailed the resort asking if it was possible to be allocated a high floor! We wernt dissapointed with the top(14th) floor apt we received! Everything was spot on! I could be petty on a few things but wont because this was a top-rate value for money cracking location condo that I cant recommend enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Sample2010
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort because of it's location near Discovery Cove as well as the affordable price. The resort proved to be more than we had hoped for! The floor plan has two separate bedroom areas which was perfect as we were two couples. The kitchen was very nice and we loved having the washer and dryer. Very nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Quite a difference in standards from our trip in June 2009”
Reviews.Author: Aquarian_Mermaid
Reviews.Content: First time we stayed at Lake Eve in June 2009 we were delighted. The units were spotless, beautiful and up to date and everything was great. We liked it so much we chose to spend 8 nights there this year. In less than a year, the standards have dropped quite a bit. Lots of little things in our unit were broken, lights out, not enough kitchen utensils etc. The toilet kept blocking which was very embarassing. Our ceiling fan in the living room did not work from the first day onwards and when maintainence came out they said they couldn't fix it because of the guarantee? The weather was in the 90's so we could have done with that ceiling fan. Rooms were clean but not spotless as they had been back in June last year. Carpets especially were getting a bit dirty. I also had issues with the pool. It is too small for the amount of guests and a resort which caters for such a large number of people could do with more than one pool. I liked to swim when it was quiet so I would get up early especially. The pool opened at 8 AM but it was full of dead bugs. There were alot of centipede/worm type things around the pool and in the pool so maybe they need to look into better pest control? The man didn't start cleaning the pool until 8.30 AM or later some mornings so the pool had less bugs in it later but why open the pool and then start cleaning it after and when people are actually in the pool? Why not clean it at 7.30am? The gym was small, no weights, just a cross trainer, bike and two treadmills. One treadmill wasn't working. The shower room in the gym had no lock on the door?! I liked that they had separate saunas for men and women though. There isn't a huge amount to do at Lake Eve. No nature walks or activities for kids. We actually snuck over to the Bluegreen Resort next door for scenic walks. We had breakfast the first morning. It was ok but very quiet and not a huge amount of choice. On our last morning we were not checking out until 11 am but from 7.45am onwards the maid kept knocking on our door hassling us to get out. The same maid came back several times over a three hour period despite us telling her we would be checking out at 11 and she had a bit of an attitude. Each day there were also many pizza and takeaway menus pushed under the door which got a bit irritating. Other resorts prevent this, but Lake Eve didn't. Overall, we would actually stay here again as it is great value for money and we were still fairly happy here. It is ok as a base but we would stay somewhere like Hilton Grand Vacations Club if we were wanting to spend more time relaxing at our resort. Please don't let things go too downhill Lake Eve! We did love you last year! And the free wi-fi was great!

Reviews.Title: “Best placed we have stayed in Orlando yet!”
Reviews.Author: decartwrights
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on a 2 bedroom unit at Lake Eve on skoosh.com. We travel to Disney a lot and this is the best place we have stayed in yet and look forward to returning in the future. The unit was spotless, very well furnished and looked to be brand new. The daily housekeeping was great too as with most condos we have found that they usually do not have daily housekeeping. I have seen previous posters that were disappointed with the lack of non-valet parking but we stayed for 8 days and we never even saw any valet, the whole lot was available to us.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: sunfunandbeach
Reviews.Content: I had a great time here. nice pool, friendly people, huge hotel rooms with great value. for transportation advice, i would suggest a second opinion if youre unsure. some of the staff werent too familiar with the bus routes, as we tried to ask about taking a bus to the airport to save money. i wouldnt recommend the shuttle bus for return trips to the hotel late at night. we were left stranded at disneyland in the cold at 11pm and then the driver claimed he tried to pick us up, but we were in an empty parking lot and there is no way he had come there. but the hotel rooms are apartment style, i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: airborn_10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at Lake Eve Resort. The hotel was awesome would stay again in a heart beat! Absolutely beautiful! Staff was kind, & helpful. It was quiet and a great location ..just minutes from all attractions. We stayed for a week and we are already looking forward to our next visit! Rooms are spacious and clean and on private laundry facilities were a wonderful addition. The pictures do not lie! If you are looking for a reasonably priced, luxurious stay I recommend this resort. The only negative was the location of the pool..the way the building is built there are limited hours for good sun! Otherwise...AMAZING

Reviews.Title: “Ask questions before you stay here.”
Reviews.Author: RNATTY
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms and clean; good floorplans. Here are the negatives: 1) Pool is closed by 10pm and folks don't get back from Disney parks before then 2) Bar closes at 10pm and parents need a drink after a long day at the parks 3) The pool is not heated, so in May -- it was cold. 4) Hotel has a "contract/deal" with a taxi company (all black vehicles) and they charge 20-30% more than Checker cabs charge for transport. Call Checker yourself! 5) They charge for internet/computer use so I couldn't print out my boarding passes 6) The breakfast is a self serve buffet but they do an auto-gratuity charge of 18% -- just mark it off -- the staff don't do ANYTHING worthy of a tip. 7) Air conditioning doesn't get very cold. 8) There is a shuttle to Disney but it makes LOTS of stops along the way -- there goes an hour!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were right”
Reviews.Author: fleewhee
Reviews.Content: this place was great. we got a great deal through travelocity and stayed here for 4 nights. considering how much we paid (and how much we saved) for the quality and size of the place, we were VERY satisfied. it's spacious, the kitchen was nice and clean, and service was good. if you're not going to do disney the entire time you're at disney, this place is HIGHLY HIGHLY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel with everything you could need”
Reviews.Author: Jules88
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 days at Lake Eve resort after being stranded due to the volcanic ash cloud. We got a good rate via Expedia and had a 2 bedroom apartment. The hotel has free wifi throughout and this worked well throughout our stay. Room The rooms were large and had really nice decor and furnishings. They had blackout blinds in the bedrooms. The 2 bathrooms, 3 TVs and washer/dryer were perfect for a family. The kitchen is well equipped and had everything we needed. The housekeeping staff come in every day to do a quick clean and make beds and then every third day they do a more through clean and change beds etc. Location The location was great at the quieter end of International Drive but really quick to get to everywhere. Sea World and Aquatica were 5 mins away - we timed it! There is a Publix supermarket just south of the hotel around 3 mins drive. Pool The pool was large and never busy - it was also heated which not all Florida pools are. There is also a jaccuzi and a wading pool for toddlers. Dining We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant. We dined in or ate elsewhere. There are plenty of restaurants within a short drive. Parking The valet parking seemed to only be on at the weekends. We didn't have a problem self parking but agree with previous posts that the car park is relatively small in comparison to the size of hotel. Staff All the staff were friendly and helpful. Summer on front desk was fantastic. Overall we loved the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Salza23
Reviews.Content: we had a two bedroom apartment and with 2 children 8 and 13 this was perfect, they had a room with 2 double beds and we had the biggest bed ever.There is also a large lounge full kitchen with dishwasher washer and dryer.It has 2 bathrooms the master with a jacuzzzi bath.We ate at the hotel one night and the food was vey good.The resort is so well placed 20 mins universal and about the same to disney.Seaworld is 2 blocks away!! The only downside is the pool looses its sun in the afternoon but the pool is clean and open till 10 so great after a busy day

Reviews.Title: “More than I could have ever expected”
Reviews.Author: Amy63501
Reviews.Content: I booked our room on hotwire.com and paid very little for a 4 night stay at Lake Eve Resort. We arrived at 11:00 pm on a Sunday night. Check-in was really fast and the staff were very friendly. We were given a room on the 9th floor and were amazed when we opened the door to our room. The floors are ceramic tile, the counter tops are marble, the appliances are stainless steel. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment. There are very large flat screen televisons in both bedrooms and the living room. The master bathroom had a jacuzzi tub and a gigantic shower. There was even a washer and dryer. The view from our balcony was amazing. It overlooked the lake and a really nice pool. The beds are incredibly comfortable, making it hard to get up in the morning. I'm not sure who our maid was, but he/she was wonderful. I never had to was a single dish during the 4 days I was there. We also had an abundance of towels, soap, and shampoo. I nearly cried when we had to leave because I loved this place so much. My only complaint is that it is a bit expensive to use the internet in the lobby. I take online classes and had to pay $10 to use the internet for 30 minutes to complete an assignment. Internet service is free in the hotel room itself, but if you do not own a laptop, then you must pay to use the internet for computers in the lobby. I will definitely stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean and friendly help.”
Reviews.Author: sueveros
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because the reviews were excellent. Everything they said was true. Our room was beautiful, food at the hotel was great. The only thing I would say they could improve on would be adding more shuttle service to and from Disney. Other than that it was wonderful, would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: travlover45
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 Bedroom 2 Bathroom Condo on the 13th floor on the end overlooking the lake. The resort looked just like the pictures and was very well kept up. The entire resort was very clean. They always left plenty of towels, shampoo, soap, tissue and even coffee and dish detergent (no detergent for the washer/dryer). We did not cook a meal but used the fridge, microwave and dishwasher for snacks... Everyone was very friendly and service oriented. We bought tickets to Universal and used the shuttle for transportation to the parks (free-just tip the driver and save $14 parking fee) which took about 25 minutes including stops. We did not eat at the restaurant. The large pool area was very nice and clean and heated to the right temperature. There are towels and plenty of lounge chairs, a jacuzzi and kids pool, and bathrooms. I believe the pool was open until 10 pm. We did have a problem with the air conditioner in our unit not cooling. They sent someone immediately and got it working. When we had car trouble on our check out day, they even allowed us to extend our checkout to 12 pm without charge. The resort is 2 miles from Sea World and convenient enough to Universal. It was quiet enough to enjoy sitting on the balcony and we enjoyed having a view of the lake and still being able to see the pool from our unit. Because there are two queen beds in the second bedroom, you can sleep 8 people- although there were only 5 of us, it seemed plenty roomy. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this resort to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: krj55755575
Reviews.Content: Wow, I can't believe some of the negative reviews about this place. I guess it just depends on your overall experience. You can't beat this place for the value. We only paid $135 per night for a three bedroom apartment, complete with granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances and a whirlpool tub. Some people were complaining about housekeeping, but I travel to Florida every year and some places (condo rentals) almost always charge an extra fee for housekeeping. Lake Eve does not charge for this service and the room rates are more than reasonable. For those people complaining about the lack of sun at the pool, you should have really read the reviews before booking this place, as many past guests stated this. I loved this place and will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious Stay”
Reviews.Author: boldlyreal
Reviews.Content: My family and I, 5 total 2 adults and 3 teens stayed at Lake Eve Resort for 12 nights in March. If I had to choose 1 word to describe Lake Eve it would be INCREDIBLE! We had a two bedroom unit. The room was exactly like the pictures on the website. It was spotless. We never had any problems with cleanliness our entire trip. The beds were so comfortable. I have issues with back pain and I didn't wake up sore at all. I secured our room through priceline and we paid $117 a night/ for our experience I would pay double that and still feel I was getting a bargain. The room is fully equipped in the kitchen and baths. Full size appliances and the most wonderful thing a washer and dryer!!!! The staff were all very gracious and helpful! The parking lot is small, however when the resort is at capacity they use a valet service. We used it when we needed to, it is free except for tips, but when the lot is full it is worth the price of the tip. The valets were also friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions. Lake Eve is somewhat secluded but within walking distance to a Publix, Walgreens, and liquor store. It was 10 minutes from Sea World, and about 20 minutes fro WDW. It is quiet and serene. Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of all the tourist locations. We had an amazing stay and will be staying at Lake Eve again when we return in 3/12!

Reviews.Title: “Great as always!!!”
Reviews.Author: PAdams626
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying at Lake Eve Resort, and I plan going there again. The rooms are very clean and spacious and we recieved maid service. I enjoyed our view from the 12th floor. Check-in was fast. My only knock on the hotel is the size of the parking lot. During peak season the lots gets full at night, but they are helpful in getting you parked. This hotel (from the higher floors) overlook Sea World, some of Downtown Disney, International Drive, you can also see Disney's Tower of Terror in the distance.
