This hotel is very quiet, even with a full house it always sounds like you're the only one on the floor. As far as people complaining about the water, to me that's a southeast thing. I was born and raised in Florida and have traveled to Georgia and the Carolinas several times. That's just the way the water smells. There is nothing any filtration or the hotel, for that matter, can do about it. The water tastes just like any other water, bottled water included. My grandmother has always told me its the minerals in the water. If you choose not to go to Lake Eve Resort, that's just more availabilty for me!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Average, Some Bad”
Reviews.Author: Ehawk81
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2 Bedroom 2 Bath Suite at Lake Eve Resort from 4/4-4/10 The Good - Size- very nice layout and big enough for a family or group of 4-8. Everything is brand new and therfore very clearn (medicore cleaning staff discussed later) The Average - Pool - Very nice heated pool with limited sun access...why would you build a resort in Florida that did not give your guests the ability to lay in the sun through out the day? Pool gets full sun for about 2 hours - we had to shift sides if we wanted to be in the sun. Cleaning staff - came by most days by 9am and if you asked them to come back they rarely did. They came back to change towels and clean our room 1 out of the 4 nights we asked them to do this and we never got clean sheets. On two of the days we came back to a very clean room with new towels, toiletries and clean dishes but, again no clean sheets. The bad - Restaurant - words cannot describe, avoid at all costs. Noise - bring ear plugs, you can hear the sound of screeching chairs all day and night long. Called down to see what could be done and no one answered. We talked to the Manager the next day and she stated it would not happen again. Needless to say, in continued for the entire trip. Again our solution was to buy earplugs. The absolute worst is the REQUIRED or as they say Complimentry Valet service. Very, Very, Very annoying. I know this sounds like a nice perk, but it s a huge hassle for most guests. You will find the non-required valet spots fill up very fast. Overall, I would NOT recomended this hotel for anything but a cheap stay in central Florida. Given sometime I think this could be a great place to stay. However, for now if you must stay on international drive I wold recomended heading to a couple of the close by resorts (we toured a lot of them and they were very nice) and pay the additional dollars to avoid any headaches and stress on your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and relaxing - Rooms are huge and beautifully decorated”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel247
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location was perfect. In-room dining very reasonable. My kids enjoyed the pool. Plenty of space for a family of 6 in the 2 bedroom platinum. Rooms decorated like a model home with well appointed extras. Made us feel at home. Cons: Stay on the 14th floor (the top floor) and the last room in the hall if you can; if not, then you'll hear noise every time someone moves their chair in the kitchen and dining room above you (the floors in the foyer, kitchen and dining room are tile). Outside noises can be heard a little more than I would like. Housekeeping was just ok. Not kept up to my standards, but I'm borderline OCD. They need more staff to help with check-in/out. Pay close attention to your statement at check-out; especially if you order in-room dining. They tacked on an extra $10 with no explanation but they removed it when I asked them about it without being rude. (Thank you) Overall: I was pleased and would stay again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Can't Wait to Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: wdwfan10
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Lake Eve Resort at the end of February, 2010. The rooms were large, beautifully decorated, and clean. Everything was modern, and obviously brand new. We got a good deal on the room booking through hotels.com. The only downside was that it took us a few days to figure out how to turn on some of the electrical outlets--they were all tied to one of the light switches in the master bedroom. The other problem we had was parking. The parking lot is very small and the hotel is very large! They will try to encourage you to valet park, then when you wake up in the morning, you will very likely be blocked in. We like to drive ourselves, so my husband made sure that he parked our vehicle himself, and went down a few minutes early in the mornings to see if we had been blocked in, which we had not. But, there is definitely not enough parking spaces and I don't know where they would park you if the hotel were at capacity! We didn't use the pool, but it looked very nice. We did not eat at their restaraunt either. We very much enjoyed our stay and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great family Stay”
Reviews.Author: israelifamily
Reviews.Content: We had a great family vacation in Orlando. Lake Eve was outstanding, the room was spacious and comfortable. We, as well as the kids didn't want to part from the room, which really is a lovely apartment. We're sorry we didn't come for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and facilities”
Reviews.Author: piglet095
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2 bedroom suite booked through a UK travel agent good rate. Suite was spacious and very well equipped. Very comfortable beds. Free Wi Fi worked well and was a real bonus. Very quiet. Lifts were fine despite 14 floors and the hotel being full. On line shop very limited but nearby supermarket (Publix) with everything you could possibly need. On site restaurant was barely acceptable for breakfast but fantastic range of eating places nearby. Pool and hot tub was a hit with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for its price”
Reviews.Author: kandy37
Reviews.Content: This hotel was dreamy to say the least, very affordable, we purchased it through hotwire mainly because it had 90% customer satisfaction and now I now they were right. The service was pleasant, we had a minor problem (our room wasn't ready due to an accident caused by a guest) so we were accomodated in a different room but the manager gave us free breakfast for the inconvinience, I thought that was nice. In our new room the next night we had to call maintenance and they came promptly and resolve our issue quickly. The 2 room suite was very spacious, warm and inviting we felt we were at a higher star hotel, I've stayed at the Hilton which is a 4 star and this place was 10x better, no doubt. The beds were clean and comfortable and the view was amazing. Next time I go to Orlando I'll stay there even if I cant find a deal through hotwire. Its just worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place and good value, but not really a RESORT”
Reviews.Author: TheF00dies
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 8 nights in March, 2010 in a very nice two bedroom unit. Paid $99 a night and it was good value at that price. The only real complaint is the noise. Good Points: *Location is great. Close to I4, parks, restaurants, Publix, Walgreens, but doesn't have "downtown" feel. *Pool and hot tub are clean and nicely heated, although pool is basic - not a resort style pool. * Parking lot is busy. Didn't like the forced valet concept at first, but by end of week we liked the convenience, although I hadn't budgeted extra tip money. Never had to wait long for valet, and the valet guys were always very helpful and cheerful. * Room is great (except for walls discussed below) and very spacious. Full kitchen and washer/dryer. Feels like an apartment. Beds are comfy. Bathrooms are great. Kitchen is nice. * Price was right at $99 a night, but I wouldn't pay more than that. Mediocre Points: *Service is in line with a budget hotel; not a top notch hotel. Never saw more than one person at front desk, and that one person's job includes answering the phone. So if you were fortunate to be at the front of the line, you would have to stand there and wait for one or more calls to end. It got to where I would call the hotel from my cell with questions, or avoid the front desk altogether. Not a big deal, and you shouldn't expect the Ritz at $99/night. * Tried the breakfast once. It was ok, but we didn't go back as it was easier to make breakfast in the kitchen. If you do eat there, buy your tickets the day before as you get a discount. The price you pay in advance includes the tip, although the ticket they give you says it does not include the tip. Web page says there's a pool side snack bar, although we never saw it open the week we were there. Maybe since the weather wasn't that hot and pool attendance was down. *Had 3 nice large TVs, but if you are planning to watch movies, bring your own DVD player as there isn't one in the room. Also bring your own laundry soap for the washer and scrubbers for dish cleaning. "Fitness Center" is a room with 2 treadmills and another areobic type machine. Also, has women and men's saunas Not-so- Great Points There's maid service, but don't expect a full cleaning. First day, we spilled some dry cheerios on rug in living room. Maid came and cheerios were still there. As an experiment, we didn't pick them up. They stayed on the rug until day 5. They bring towels and make beds, but they don't really clean. Still, it's better than a timeshare rental. *It is supposed to have WIFI, which it does, but it is intermittent. Sometimes it worked fine. Other times it worked with a low signal, and other times it didn't work at all. If you need guaranteed access to internet, it's not the right place. *The only real complaint is that the walls seemed thin. You hear some from the neighbors on the sides, and the worst is that you hear chairs scraping across the tile floor from neighbors above. One night there must have been an all night poker game going above us and we got little to no sleep that night. Definitely bring ear plugs. Overall, a good experience. Had I been able to sleep each night, I would rate it a 5 (for the money) but I rate it a "4" due to the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: arob5611
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Orlando with my husband, and 9 and 12 yr old sons. We stayed in Lake Eve's 2BR Suite. My husband and children really enjoyed the heated pool and the view from our 3rd floor room. Customer service was excellent and our rooms were serviced daily without any add'l charge. We absolutely loved this place. Although located on the quiet end of International Drive, Lake Eve Resort is conveniently located near shops, restaurants, and attractions. This home away from home saved us alot of money. We bought groceries and cooked and the kitchen is fully stocked; not to mention the washer and dryer in room. Wonderful! Will definitely stay again. Only wish mattress was pillow top, could be softer. Be aware $9 per night resort fee and $100 hold for debit card users, not charged, just a hold for incidentals.

Reviews.Title: “Like having an apartment on vacation”
Reviews.Author: SoFlaFamily
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our three-night stay at the Lake Eve Resort. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite, which was plenty of room for two adults and a toddler. The rooms were spacious and clean and the full kitchen (which was fully stocked) was nice since it gave us the option to cook, make sandwiches or just buy snacks at the supermarket and store them in the fridge. The location was close to Disney (and even closer to Seaworld). One of the issues we had were that on the first night the WiFi wasn't working. The front desk said they would send an "engineer" to help, but all the engineer did when he showed up was hand us a paper with instructions that did not help us access the WiFi at all. I suspect the problem was that the hotel was packed that night and too many people were using the WiFi at once, but this was never acknowledged and everything was working the following morning. Another tiny issue was that a maid showed up to clean our room one morning at 9 a.m. When we indicated that we would likely be another hour before leaving, she seemed put out about having to return and really pressed us for a time before leaving. That said, service overall was wonderful. When we asked for extra towels they were at our door immediately. The front desk staff was friendly and quick. The valet staff also was very courteous to us even though we did not use the complimentary service during our stay (we did not want to wait around for our car and the self-parking was convenient enough). One thing for families with small children: the bathroom sink was really too high for my toddler to reach, so washing his hands and brushing his teeth were a little challenging. Ultimately this was a tiny thing, though, but something to keep in mind. We enjoyed our stay here and look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbaLakeEveResort
Reviews.Content: I just spent 11 nights at the Lake Eve Resort while visiting the parks with my 3 adolescent children and my parents. The hotel is very well located at the southern end of International Drive, 15 minutes to Disney parks and Universal and 5 minutes to Sea World. Orlando Primium Outlet is a block away and the Florida Mall is 30 minutes away. The 2 bedroom suite is very convenient. There is a king size master bedroom with its own bathroom with separate shower an jacuzzi. The second bedroom has two queen beds, and the livingroom has a queen sofabed (my son slept there a couple of nights but did not seem very comfortable). The beds are very comfortable. There is another bathroom, an open kitchen and a dinning table for six. The parking lot is too small for the hotel, and on weekends, it gets very crowded, so they offer complimentary valet parking which was nice. There was a strange odor in the lobby and at the entrance. The cleanning service was good. They made the beds, cleaned the bathrooms, and changed toiletries everyday; but cleaned thoroughly and changed the sheets every 3 days. There is a washer and dryer as well as a dishwasher. The maid would clean anything we left on the sink. There is everything you need to cook except a sponge. The elevator was slow. Free internet, restaurant and room service.

Reviews.Title: “I'd like it to stay my little secret...”
Reviews.Author: jojomagic
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations and I was totally satisfied! We had a 2 bedroom suite. We had so much space, the beds were comfortable, the closets plentiful, the kitchen fully stocked, we were very comfortable. The weather was less than gorgeous, but that didn't stop us from enjoying the outdoor pool, it was always warm. My only complaints are that you can easily hear the chairs in the upstairs room being pushed around on the floor upstairs and the in-house restaurant was not that great (although we enjoyed the pizza). Overall, we had an amazing time and would go again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space - superb value”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlier56
Reviews.Content: The family room was in fact an appartment with 2 bedrooms and bathrooms as well as a lounge and fully equipped kitchen (including a washer and drier); it was in immaculate condition and just as described. Although the "resort" did not offer a lot in the way of facilities (heated pool, hot tub and small gym) it was ideal for a short break taking advantage of the many local attractions. At $130 night including taxes and "resort fee" it was a little more expensive than a standard hotel room but represented outstanding value. I would certainly return here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort I ever stayed in. Great Family resort.”
Reviews.Author: mrsushi
Reviews.Content: We went on a off peak season. The weather is perfect. 73 degree. We got a two bedroom suite for only $99 per night. Two bedrooms, two full bath, full kitchen, balcony, and washer and dryer too. wow. The resort is very very clean. The decor is modern and comfortable. The staffs are very nice. The resort is located between Disney and Universal Studio. We rented a car from budget. Getting around is very easy. Notice! if you get car from Budget, be ready to hassle with their customer sales. They want you to add insurance and extra this and that. I just say no to everything. Also, Benihanna Japanese restaurant is just next door from the resort. They have the best Japanese Hibachi experience. A must visit restaurant. I will stay in LAKE EVE RESORT on my next trip in Orlando. This is my best resort I ever stayed. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lake Eve is Terrific & Christian (Private Taxi) was great”
Reviews.Author: Janemcharms
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Lake Eve for 2 weeks in December and loved it, this was our 4th visit to Orlando and we have stayed at various hotels and also at disney but this was by far the best for Accomodation and Great Service, All the Girls at Reception were so so nice and helpful and the ladies in the gift shop were lovely to us all. The hotel is a little of the ma9in strip but the trolley bus stops right ouside and there is a great car service from the hotel, Christian was fab, always turned up on time, so polite and helpful, Conor loved him(probably because he brought him his 1st american football). everyone at the hotel was really nice, the only negative comment would have to be the restaurent, it could be better but that is the only one and I am really fussy about hotels and accomodation. ~They even arranged a cake and balloon for Conors Birthday. If you know Christian and read this, please tell him that we think he's great and will hopefully be back this year. thats Jane, Josh & Conor - terrific hotel and lovely people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: sunny_nmb
Reviews.Content: We were at Lake Eve on weekend of 2/5/10 to take in a couple of days of Disney & the night shuttle launch. The hotel was great: the rooms were EXACTLY like the photos shown on their website; the layout was very much like most condos... very comfortable like home; plenty of towels, supplies, and closet space; the kitchen was clean, very new with granite counters. I was very surprised how nice the place was since we got a great deal on the price (grand total for 2 nights @ $210 for 2 bedrooms unit). Definitely a four-star resort. Free wifi in rooms, free parking, whirlpool in master bath. Unfortunately, we didn't get to try out the pool or fitness gym since it was quite cold and rainy that weekend. We stayed at Floridays (a hotel that's a few doors down the street) a couple months before & this place is definitely better. They offered shuttle to Epcot (for those without ride/don't want to drive) with 3 scheduled pickups in the mornings & 3 times in the evening return. Really enjoyed this place since it was nice & quiet even though it catered to families. We come to Orlando often and other places usually have too many sports/team/group booked where the noise level is quite loud at times. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and a good location”
Reviews.Author: ericdetwiler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is kind of off the beaten path which was nice. The rooms are spacious and well kept. We had the 2 bedroom and it was great for our family. Good internet connection and service. Parking was horrible. That is the one complaint that I have. The parking lot is too small and the valet parking is an option but for those of us that do not like to hand our keys over to a stranger or tip constantly this was not an option. Other than that the staff was efficient and friendly. The room was awesome and the view over the lake was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room's - In House restaurant leaves much to be desired!”
Reviews.Author: nikiboxer
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great, clean, and spacious. The 24 hour fitness center is just two treadmills, an eliptical and stationary bike. No a/c, no TV or music. The restaurant's food stinks, the pizza was like cardboard. The breakfast buffet was ok, just take advantage of the 5$ prepay option. Save yourself some money and use the beatiful fully equipped kitchen in your room for eating, or dine outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, New, Clean Condo resort”
Reviews.Author: Andrew-Lorraine
Reviews.Content: Booked with Hotwire and paid $96 plus taxes, and they charged $7.50 resort fee per night, front desk staff were very friendly & helpful, upmarket accomodation clean & new, very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Florida cold blast”
Reviews.Author: TammieC15
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here over the "Florida cold blast" of 2010. Even though the weather was cold every employee had a sense of humor and made us feel better about it, coming from minnesota the kids were still able to enjoy the heated pool and jacuzzi thanks to everyone our vacation a warm stay. Planning to return in April to enjoy the weather the way it should be. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home. Need space?, not a problem.”
Reviews.Author: outatime_10
Reviews.Content: Lake Eve Resort is a fairly a new resort, the rooms are just fantastic we had a two bedroom with 2 bathrooms plenty of storage a nice full kitchen just what their web site calls for (believe it). We had a couple of minor problems but fixed immediatley. Room service is VERY good they are quick and concerned about there customers. We found this place with a great deal on priceline.com (what a great price) could not resist and do not regret. If there anyone out there looking for a place to stay you will definetly love this place.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best choice look no further”
Reviews.Author: Traveluxx
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an extended weekend st lake eve this is your best choice because the hotel is absolutely beautiful, it is a new hotel just shy of one yrs old the 3bd we stayed in was huge with large balcony great decor high end stainless and granite in kitchens and baths (2) lite daily housekeeping is included no extra cleaning fees free wifi convenient location great helpful staff all for $115 per nite on priceline they have a heated pool and hot tub which I did not use saw kids and adults enjoying it they also offer a Disney shuttle this condo-hotel is Orlandos best kept secret Aldo has w/d they refill all soap coffee towels etc everyday I almost forgot the best pay of this hotel stay was the beds soooooo comfortable even one of the guest that was with us remarked on it flatscreens in every bdrm too much to share all around excellent and comfortable stay! Book it you can't go wrong

Reviews.Title: “Proceed With Caution”
Reviews.Author: Rhettsky
Reviews.Content: Although the resort appeared to be very clean and kept up, there are other problems. Upon arriving on New Years Eve, with plans for that evening, we were told that they didn't have a room for us and would be sending us to a new hotel. This was especially upsetting because we had called to confirm this reservation several times. The staff was not concerned with the inconvenience created nor did they apologize. The manager was incredibly rude. We ended up staying at a Marriott for the entire vacation instead. Customer service is horrible at his hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BUYER BEWARE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nowheretgo
Reviews.Content: I booked this motel in August for a 4 day vacation for New Years. I called about 5 times to confirm. I was never informed of any problems with my reservations. I received an email comfirmation and lake eve had my phone number. Yet, after a long day at work and drive there I went to check in. At that point the manager told me that my party could not stay because he over booked did not have a room (He was now booking rooms at $245 a night now and I paid much less by booking 6 months ahead ,he booted me for a higher paying guest) He was going to put me up at another motel for only one of my 3 nights (he would only pay for the difference in the lake st eve room and the other hotel). I told him I would take the reassignment if he would make arrangements for me to stay in one hotel for my entire stay and not move but I did not want to spend my vacation moving. He would not put me in one motel. When I complained the manager was rude and basically said tough luck. He then said he was going to call the police on me if I did not leave. After that he threatened to cancel my reservation entirely and because it was new years eve it would leave me without a place to stay. The new room at a different motel to have a sofa bed and one bed instead of the 2 beds booked for and a decrease in some things that we had planed on having at lake eves. We are two old ladies with bad backs. This was a real night mare. I can say they ruined my entire vacation because they wanted to make a few more bucks on a room. Their word or confirmation does not mean anything. The manager told me "they do this all the time" and I should just accept this change as the standard way they do business. Do not book here. Their word means nothing. The room you reserve is always available to the highest bidder and you really do not have a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “MUCH TOO NICE FOR THE BARGAIN PRICE - FRIENDLIEST WORKERS!”
Reviews.Author: ritzB8
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure to experience staying at this resort for 3 weeks while in the process of moving into a new location in Orlando. I was offered a 2 bedroom suite at $69+taxes a nite for the entire stay. Lake Eve Resort is located in the Buena Vista area of Orlando close to Disney and Universal. It is in a quiet section of International Drive South. Newly opened this year, there are many promotional rates available. The PR/Sales manager gave me a great deal after I found an advertisement in Craigs List when I was searching for temporary stays in a hotel/townhomes. I had the opportunity to spend almost every night at their restaurant/bar. From Trevor, the chef; bartenders - George and Jose; and front desk persons, Summer and Nina; everyone made us feel comfortable and welcomed. As soon as you walk in, you will notice Summer's big sweet smile. You cannot miss her. Every room is a suite and has a kitchen, two flat screen in one bedrooms and three flat screen tv's in 2 bedrooms, etc. Every room's balcony overlooks their elegant poolside and cabana. Unfortunately, it was very cold when we were staying there, we never had the opportunity to hang out at the pool. Weather was 40-60 degrees and chilly. There is a free wireless internet available. There's not much to say about breakfast buffet since we were always rushing out the door first thing in the a.m. but from what I heard from one guest, it was nothing to write home about. There are many restaurants in the area so you don't have to stick to one place. There is a very good sushi restaurant around the corner nearby the Publix shopping center. Lake Eve recently changed their menu for the better. Prior to the change it was offering steakhouse menus with some kind of an Indian flair. Thank god, that's changed. It just didn't fit to the image of the restaurant. Ask for Trevor, he'll take care of your taste bud, if he has the ingredients to whip up something! This is a busy season around Christmas and New Years and Orlando is buzzing! Traffic is beyond terrible and nightmarish. Avoid Buena Vista around I4 area. Take local roads if possible. All in all, Lake Eve Resort is a great, quality place, value for money. Clean, new, accessible to downtown Disney area and to Universal. Friendliest staff made me very comfortable and took care of whatever requests we had. Thank you to everyone and Dana and Summer, you both were great and made us very special!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome deal and wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hope400
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a three bedroom suite and it was larger than the first apartment I lived in! The staff was pleasant and the room was clean. The price for the three bedroom suite was a great deal. I will definitely stay at this hotel again when I visit Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home away from home”
Reviews.Author: weluv2trot
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fantastic trip to Disney world and were so impressed with the rooms at Lake Eve resort. We enjoyed a beautiful 2 bedroom suite for 5 nights and were travelling with a small child, a teenager, adults and grandparents. All had a great time. The spacious suite afforded room for all and the full kitchen (dishes, dishwasher, pots, stove, oven, etc.) made for quite a cost effective vacation. We were very impressed with the quality of the accomodation for the price. The kitchen was very well equiped, the only thing we missed was a frying pan. The Publix supermaket and Orlando premium outlets are only about a 15 min walk away (or two trolley bus stops away). The free shuttle to Disney was very convenient although we ended up taking cabs home some of the days since the first shuttle didn't come back until 5:30 pm and we were quite tired. The pool is actually nicer than it shows in the hotel's website and is heated which is sooo nice in the winter months. We did not try the restaurant and it did not seem busy at all during our stay. Front desk service could be more friendly and housekeeping was slightly inconsistent at times but the beautiful accomodations more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ustation
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly staff, affordable and decent location! Near the Premium Outlet Mall, a Walgreens and a Super Market. A 15 minute drive off the main area on International Drive. We had a large family and it was a perfect setup. Be warned, sleeping on the pull out couch was awful though. Thin mattress, and you could feel every spring.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cruisequeen0
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Lake Eve and were stunned at the size and quality of the 2 bedroom suite we had booked it was immaculate, comfortable beds, loads of towels, extra pillows, blankets etc. The kitchen was very well equipped even down to having dishwasher powder supplied. The hotel is in a fantastic position on International Drive, at the bottom where it is very quiet, but only a few minutes drive from Disney World and Seaworld. The Premium Outlets is just around the corner as is a Publix if you want to food shop. I couldn't recommend this hotel more, staff were very helpful with anything we needed information on and couldn't do enough to help. We will be booking Lake Eve for our 2010 Orlando visit.

Reviews.Title: “True to their Web site”
Reviews.Author: Timar123
Reviews.Content: Just returned and no complaints at all. One or two minor issues that were resolved immediately, nothing major (ironing board needed to be replaced, remote on one of the 3 tv's didn't work, probably just needed new batteries). The only thing that did not meet my wish list was the shuttle service to the parks, for my needs it was too limited so it was good that I had my car and friends in Orlando. I would stay there again and recommend it to family and friends. Staff was great!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale without feeling ripped off!”
Reviews.Author: ownhome
Reviews.Content: What a great property and room! Lots of space, comfortable beds, nice linens & towels, complete kitchen, wonderful t.v.'s, and big balcony. A lot of bang for your buck. We only stayed one night on a business trip so I can't comment on housekeeping. We had driven for 10 hours so we did eat in the restaurant. I can't comment much on that, as we had hamburgers and salads & they aren't enough to form an opinion. I would go back on a family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest place I ever stay at in Orlando,Florida.”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamper1504
Reviews.Content: Lake Eve Resort is a beautiful place to stay. Everything I saw on their website was true to form. The hotel staff was wonderful, especially the bell hop Gavinda. He so helpful when we were checking out. Me and my kids spend the whole day at the theme park and left a do not disturb sign on our door. To come back and find a fresh set of towels,tissues,bathroom and kitchen supplies,. I was quite surprise. I found the room well stocked with anything you would need to cook a meal (pots,dishes,utensils,etc). The beds were so comfort ,the rooms was so huge,clean. It was more than enough room for me and my two kids. I just fell in love with this place and I plan on stay at Lake Eve resort whenever I visit Orlando. Hopefully room 406 is available, I just love the view from the balcony. I just wish we could've stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CONDO”
Reviews.Author: SARRECAT
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for a work seminar with a coworker and it was perfect! We had a corner 2 bedroom unit. The master bedroom has the bathroom connected. The 2nd bedroom is on the other side of the unit and has the bathroom just across the hall. I loved that it was new and the decor is simple. I loved the view as well, we were on the 12th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Lake Eve Resort was wonderful, the accommodation was second to none.”
Reviews.Author: lawlor4
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two week stay at Lake Eve Resort in Orlando. I travelled with my family,aged from pensioners to an eleven year old, with two teenagers thrown in for good measure. This resort suited everyone, we had two 2bed condos on 14th floor and they couldn't have been better, the view out over the lake was amazing particularly at sunset. We had an iron and ironing board and the housekeeping came every day and did a great job, they left us fresh supplies of everything from toilet paper to washing up liquid. The pool was wonderfully warm for the first 8 days , but then it was cold for another two, I didn't complain as we were out most of the time. The girls in reception couldn't have been more helpful, any problem we had was addressed ( a bulb went in the kitchen one morning and it was fixed within ten minutes). They were always on hand to give directions and when we told them we were going shopping they gave us vouchers for discounts at various malls and outlet stores. I will not hesitate to stay there again when in Orlando and will give it's web address to any of my friends who want to go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful - can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Suzy904
Reviews.Content: I first want to say that this place is so much better than anywhere in Orlando that I've ever stayed. We were only there for the weekend and didn't spend much time at the resort but boy do I wish we could have. We had a two bedroom unit on the 10th floor. It was immaculately clean, very nicely decorated and so comfortable. The pictures on the website are accurate. From the granite countertops to the flat screen tv's and jetted garden tub we were as comfortable as if we had been at home. The front desk folks were very nice and helpful. We visited the restaraunt but didn't stay - it's middle eastern cuisine and pretty pricey - instead we ordered pizza delivery. We did grab a couple of drinks at the bar and the bartender was really nice - he even bagged up beer for us to take up to the room. For sure our next trip to Orlando will include staying at the Lake Eve Resort - unless things change I can't see any reason to ever stay anywhere else. The resort is located in a very quiet area of I drive away from the hustle and bustle, but still only a few minutes to Disney and shopping. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: magster99
Reviews.Content: The place was phenomenal and the two bedroom suite had plenty of room for 5 of us and it can hold up to 8 people. The staff was very attentive to our needs and came right away when we called that we needed something. It would be nice to have a dvd player in each room so people on vacation can watch movies and relax.The house keeping needs to be improved but overall it was a great experience. Summer at the front desk was especially attentive and knowledgeable

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Digs, Budget Pricing”
Reviews.Author: comediangarywest
Reviews.Content: This was the nicest hotel I have stayed at in the Orlando area in the past 5 years. The 2 bedroom suite was spotless, the beds were very comfortable and the staff was polite, professional and helpful. The only "extra charge" item was a $7 resort fee for the use of the health club (didn't use it), the pool area (didn't use it) and the WiFi (didn't use it) . Overall, this was a quiet and totally enjoyable stay for the money which cost a total of $112 for the overnight stay. I think this is an absolute bargain for a two bedroom suite including a full kitchen, jacuzzi tub (used it) bathroom and a 12th floor balcony with a view of the pool, Seaworld and the adjacent lake. I recommend this property HIGHLY to anyone who is coming to Orlando. The only suggestion I would have... bring your own beverages... there is not even a soda machine on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Most for the Money”
Reviews.Author: machiela
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful alternative to the busy Disney Hotels. VERY clean. Service and staff were outstanding. Great place to stay for a few days since there is a full kitchen. We had the 2 bedroom suite and had more than enough room with our 4 children.

Reviews.Title: “"Exuberant" - Just What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: DutuchInn
Reviews.Content: We just left luxury and enjoyed it. We stayed from Oct 18-21, 2009 and it's the best I've experienced in my stateside travels. Peaceful, end room, and excellence service. All that I wanted in a suite. We were there for Disney and they even offer shuttle servie to Epcot and you go from there to any theme park you like and they pick up. We had an end room with lake view and pool view, large private balcony and jetted tub. A lot of standard, like flatscreen in every room, but considered upgrades any other place. No kids were running around, but were seen. Sweet deal. I will be back again. A satisified customer....Thanks Lake Eve Resort for making my vacation real.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Tourist0906
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for Halloween Horror Nights, the rate I got was unbeatable. When we checked in at 3:00 pm on Saturday there was only one person in the front desk checking people in and out so we had to wait about 30 minutes, finally they put in another employee. Our unit was very spacious, nice and clean. Management seems to be new at renting units for short stays so some of the toiletries you usually get in a hotels were not there. Let's not talk about the sofa bed, I was very surprised that a new complex like this hotel is would have such an unconfortable sofa bed. Whe we have stayed at the newer hotel the sofa beds are extremely confortable. So if you are staying at this hote and you plan to use the sofa bed make sure you bring a blow up mattress to put on it. Another complain was the service we got from house keeping. We went down stairs and requested 2 pillow and another mattress to put on top of the one on the sofa already and towels and we never received them. There also were not enough towels in the room for the 6 people the unit is suppose to hold. The parking was a major issue, when we arrived from the park the security had to tell us where to park because all the parking spots were full. But overall our stay was very pleasant and knowing the hotel flaws I already know exactly what to expect. The

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort- Hidden Deal for Theme parks”
Reviews.Author: MDFamilyGambrills_MD
Reviews.Content: Lake Eve Resort was excellent. Michelle was great to work with. The price she quoted (best price I found after extensive search on the internet) was the total price we paid. No hidden charges. Best of all we were surprised when we checked in and found that we were upgraded to a two bedroom suite at no extra charge. Staff responded super fast when we called front desk.Our 5 y.o. daughter thought she was a princess with her own bedroom w/ double queen beds, large plasma TV and own bathroom. Housekeeping even layed out her favorite blanky and Squeaky every day on her bed after making it (nice touch). I would dismiss all previous complaints as the have new management team in place (I talked with GM personally, He was there day & night). Also from our 12th floor room we could see Disney firewrks great. Real close to Publix Supermarket and 24 Hour Walgreen's Pharmacy. 10 min. to Seaworld/ Aquatica, 30 min. to WDW. Housekeeping did great job cleaning up after our breakfast dishes/pans every morning so we could get early jump on day. I highly reccomend this resort, so take just a few clothes (washer & dryer) on a carry-on and feel like you are at your second vacation home Only suggestion would be to put felt pads on bottom of chairs and stools to quite scrapping noise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: GAfunfam4
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. The staff was gracious enough to upgrade us to a 2 bedroom condo that was both beautiful and spacious. Everything was new - from the granite countertops, to the jetted tub and plasma TV's! We enjoyed our trip and for such a great value, will certainly be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: jdgomez
Reviews.Content: we were very impress by this hotel... we loved the accomodations and the service was outstanding. we loved it so much and the price can't be beat that we are returning in December. The rooms are awsome and spacious it still smells like new furniture in the rooms, housekeeping comes in everyday and it's at no additional cost to us. The only bad side that we can see, is that for such a big hotel the parking ratio to rooms is not equivalent and they need more parking spaces, but we always had a parking space so no problem for us. We love this hotel. this is defenitely a hidden jewel! jenny

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: PauloRJ
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for an excellent price. I found exactly what I was expecting and looking for. I decided for this hotel based on the 80% approval (good reviews), but I confess I was concerned because of some bad reviews I read here. What I can say is that I am fully satisfied and that's why I am writing this review during my 2nd day at the hotel (using free wireless internet). We (me, wife and 2 kids - 11/3) got a 2 bedroom apartment. Very clean, spacious, complete - complete kitchen (big refrigerator, oven, microwave, dish washer, pans, dishes, silverware etc.), washer/dryer in the room, dinner table with 6 chairs, spacious room with balcony, nice decoration, nice and comfortable bedrooms, central air conditioning, ceiling fans, free wireless internet, big baths (one with separated tub/shower). LCD screens on all rooms. New, comfortable and clean - my wife is very demanding in terms of cleanness and is fully satisfied. Location is fantastic - relatively close to all parks (half way between Disney/Sea World), on a very calm part of Int'l Drive and very close to Publix, Outback, Walgreens and others. Very friendly staff helped me with all my requests at arrival. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: aidensmile
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Lake Eve with my children ages 3 and 12 as well as my parents. The room was fantastic, nicely decorated, kitchen, washer and dryer, clean and attractive. The kids and I really enjoyed the pool. It was close to Sea World and Disney and the price was incredible for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Rooms, Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: danit24
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very friendly the staff and was very accomodating. The rooms are very well appointed and clean. Everything about the stay was great. Because of a late flight, we needed to check out late and were offered a check out time of 4pm with only a small charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: digitaldarth
Reviews.Content: We drove from NC to Orlando all night planning to go straight to Sea World and then check in the room at the end of the day. We arrived VERY early in Orlando and we went by to see if by chance we could check in early. The staff at the front desk could not have been nicer. They checked us in and we were in the room in no time. VERY clean and VERY nice. When we needed some items after a few days a simple phone call to the front desk was made and within 5 minutes a staff member was at the door with every item we requested. We ate breakfast (Buffet) at the hotel 2 mornings and were pleased with the quality and the price ($7 per person). If you are headed to Orlando give these guys a try. Our experience was a very positive one and we will not hesitate to go back. As for the flyers under the doors.......Pizza places stick a flyer under the door. It's not a big deal. We actually ordered food in one night and used one of the coupons. Saved some $$$ too.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth it”
Reviews.Author: SwTLadY
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Lake Eve Resort for 2 nights we had a 2bd apartment. Our flight was late so we had to check in late, when we first got there we didn't have any help there were no bell men, then at the front desk we waited 10minutes to be attended to and we were the only group there that late. The girl looked as if she were sleeping or just ignoring us. The room was amazing however not so clean, there was something sticky all over the bathroom floor in the master bedroom. The phone in the room also didn't work, when I called down to front desk they said they would send someone up, but they never came. Just ignoring all that trying to have a nice vacation, I kept getting weird flyers under the doors, which scared me and my children. There is no secerty! well finally when checking out excited about going home the receptionist just seemed very rude when I and talked under her breath alot, she seemed very angry about who knows but tended to take anger out on guest. This hotel is however nice but the staff has to go or management needs to train more professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive!!”
Reviews.Author: ebeth916
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely one of the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in, and I have been going to Disney every year for the past 20 years. The rooms are very nicely decorated with new, beautiful furniture, the counter tops in the kitchen and bathrooms are granite and the living room furniture is actually comfortable! (that's a first). The kitchen is stocked with everything you could possibly need. The best part for me was that there was a washer and dryer. That was SOOOO convenient!!! The room had high speed internet service that worked fast and perfect every time. I found the maid staff to be extremely friendly and efficient. They tried to come in and clean on the first day (at a reasonable time in the morning), but since I do it myself no matter where we stay, I didn't need them to come in, but to everyone who wants the daily maid service - it WILL get done. All we needed each day were trash bags, fresh towels, coffee, dish washing soap, ect...and they provided all of it each and every day. Most of the front desk was pretty friendly. They got us checked in and all of our paperwork done in about 10 minutes. They also let us have a late checkout since they were slow, which we really appreciated! There was one problem with the front desk that I should mention. On our second day, we were all out at the pool and I wanted to run up to our room to use the bathroom. When I got up there, my key wouldn't work. I simply thought it needed to be re-set so I went back downstairs to get that done, but when I told the girl at the front desk that my key wasn't working, she said it was because I was supposed to be checking out that day. I told her, "no, I wasn't checking out for 3 more days." She of course argued with me, so I told her if she would let me up to use the bathroom, I would bring my paperwork down with me. While I was in the room, she called my room to tell me that she got it straightened out, but I missed the call and didn't find all this out until I got back downstairs with my confirmation papers. It all got worked out, but I spent the last hour that the sun was out (a storm was coming) running back and forth from my room to the front desk trying to prove to her that I was in fact supposed to be there, so that was pretty frustrating. The other problem was that I noticed on my second day, after I looked at my online credit card statement, I could see the charges from Lake Eve Resort. I noticed that they charged me an extra $50.00 more than what I was supposed to originally be charged, so I went downstairs to find out why. I was told that I was charged the extra $50.00 at the check in time for incidentals (room service, room damages, ect...) and that it would be credited right back to me the day I checked out. I have not seen the credit on my online statement yet, but this is only my second day home. The pool and pool area were really big and clean - I loved the chaise chairs, but the water was WAY to hot - 93 degrees! in the middle of September in Florida!. The day we spent at the pool, the pool guy was there cleaning and said he would adjust the tempature of the pool, because he also agreed that the pool was to warm. I'm sure they have it that warm so people can comfortably swim at night (which it was nice at night as we did swim then to), but during the day, 93 is just to hot. Another thing that I didn't like about the pool was that you can't get ANY sunshine until about 11:00 am because of the way the building is shaped. The building blocks the sun from every angle until about 11:00 am and after 3:00 pm. A few things about the hotel that might be annoying to some people are that there are no alarm clocks, there is no phone book, pencil or paper or TV guide. There isn't much to do for kids, so if your traveling with young one's, keep that in mind. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to a friend and I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card statements!”
Reviews.Author: Peep2009
Reviews.Content: While the resort was great, I'm paying double for it now. We stayed at Lake Eve the last week of 04/09 and 1st week of 05/09 and was promptly billed. Then much to my surprise, a charge of almost $1100 showed up on my 07/09 statement. I called the resort, but no one seemed to care or cared to help. I was told that perhaps I had overlooked the original charges and that I needed to fax my CC statements, which I did three times. Although each time was successful, the staff couldn't seem to find them. On another call, I was told it was probably my fault. That I could have been charged for simply looking at prices for next year. Somehow the website automagically pulled my credit card information and billed the card. Although I don't have any sort of confirmation email nor do they seem to have one at the resort either. After many phone calls, I still have not been able to speak with a manager. In fact, today I was told that they had to let me go because a customer needed help. I had wanted to stay at the resort next year, but now I will never step foot in the place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic suites and good location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJane25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights following holiday on east coast and the keys to visit theme parks and shops in Orlando. The welcome was not the best as the receptionist had been told to answer phone calls before the person standing in front of them. After 4/5 calls i managed to get her attention. She was apologetic but i still had to wait a while to book in. With the apology came an upgrade to a platinum resort suite !. So couldn't complain . All other staff at the hotel were very friendly and attentive. The suites were fantastic and so spacious with all "mod cons" . The on-suite bathroom was huge with a spa bath and double shower. We were on 13th floor so had good views over to seaworld. Due to the shear size of these suites there were a lot of large families in residence so if you expect some quiet at the night you will be disappointed as they enjoy themselves in or around the pool or on the large balconies overlooking the pool. Did not use the gym nor the pool or eating facilities. Great location for travelling to the theme parks or International Drive for eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Podgorica21
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. Brand new and very nice and spacious rooms - we booked the two bedrooms. High grade of furnishing and fully fitted kitchen, large bathrooms with ample storage space. I would be happy living there. Large pool (which is in the shade from early afternoon which is good for a swim and a lie down after an exhausting day in the theme parks). Staff extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “WOW it really is a upscale for value price”
Reviews.Author: The_Waycasters
Reviews.Content: We booked through an online travel site for about a hundred bucks a night. Our two bedroom unit is absolutely gorgeous. The resort is really nice. It may be the economy or it may just be a newer building / new management trying to get a customer base built, but I wouldnt expect these rates to stay this low very long. In fact there is one of those cheesy notices on the back of the door like in all hotels that says the rack rate is 359 a night. I would expect to pay twice what I paid for this room anywhere else in the Orlando area. Very nice will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious upscale rooms for the value price, great Sea World location”
Reviews.Author: ClanGFlorida
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many five star upscale hotels, and budget value as well. This was a great option for us, especially for the price. We traveled with our 2 young babies and grandparents, and we booked 2 rooms because I am big on space and privacy. In retrospect, we could have easily stayed in one room. The premium room we booked was on the 13th floor, had a beautiful view of the lake and surrounding parks (nice for fireworks at night), and plenty of space. It had a full kitchen, washer/dryer, 2 full bathrooms, and a pull out couch as well. The maid service is every 3rd day, its not everyday, but they did check on towels and make beds everyday. For the 119$ A night we paid, it was a very nice option and we would definitely recommend it. The restaurant was decent, and the pool was also very nice. If you are looking for upscale overall, you aren't going to get it in that price range, but the room was beautiful and spacious and more than we had hoped for, and we loved the easy 1 mile drive to Sea World area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms! Pleasant stay! Would do it again!”
Reviews.Author: ytap
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip here for 7 days and ended up staying one more night we loved it so much!!! Our first experience with the staff was a young guy name Gio who helped us with our luggage (and we brought lots of it.) He was friendly and very pleasant. Gio was the best, he helped us with our groceries, greeted us everytime we saw him, and was the sweetest kid. The rooms were beautiful and had just about everything we needed. Pots, pans, tupperware, flatware, dinnerware, cups, etc. Might want to bring your own sponge and dish soap. If not you can always use the dishwasher. Housekeeping will also do dishes for you! They do come every day. The weekends seemed to get pretty booked around this time and the parking was full one night when we returned really late, like 4 am. We had to park in a fire lane, but we left our key at the front desk and they moved it for us in the morning. No big deal, they were great about it. Also the pool bar was still not open as they are waiting for a licquor license. This was not an issue for us. We brought a cooler and stocked it with drinks and brought it down. Kept our bevarage expenses low, so it wan't a bad thing. My sons brought their Xbox and there was no audio adaptor available so they had to play with no sound. Once again, wasn't an issue for me cause I rather not hear the niose anyway. :-) They are new and are still working on some things but all in all we had a great experience, and I have no complaints. We do plan on going back if the rates stay reasonable. If anyone from Lake Eve reads this, give Gio a raise. We were there for 8 days and he worked every single day, and he works hard. Oh and keep the pool open till 12am at least!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value in luxurious accomodations !”
Reviews.Author: pforgione
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay. The hotel was above and beyond anything we could have hoped for. The premises is spotless, pool is fantastic, houscleaning was spot on every day with a very pleasant staff. Front desk was always accomodating. There may have been some problems with the service in the past (As I have read in other reviews) but we had absolutely no issues. Proximity to theme parks is great as any park can be reached within 10 minutes. Access to food and shopping is also a hop skip away. No need to hesitate...I hope to return often.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, badly run.”
Reviews.Author: luv_my_passat
Reviews.Content: First the good: Rooms were nice, clean, great location not too far from all the attractions. The pool was awsome. We got a good Grand Opening rate. Nice washer and dryer, awesome full fridge, and dish washer. Now the Bad: The hotel staff seemed clueless, not very professional. They seemed to know little about the facility. I asked for towels for the pool, and the lady at the fron deask said there's a bin full of them next to the pool. After looking for several minutes, I askerd her again and admitted she had never even seen the pool area and couldn't tell me where to get towels. They upgraded my room for free to from a one bedroom suite to a 2 bedroom suite so our group could be close together. To be fair, the staff seemed nice, but there was just a level of unprofessionalism that seemed very odd. We didn't know whether or not the laundry soap was free. The group in the room next to use got free soap the whole time, while I had to pay at the very small gift shop. There were unruly guests at the pool when we stayed, and were even harassed by and spit on by them from their balcony. There were no hotel staff at the pool to keep things in control. The same kids made a terrible mess (feces) in the restroom. When I notified the mamager, they had told me they had several complaints about them and that they were taking care of it. We left before I could tell if the problem was taken care of. On another note, the chairs in the dining area make so much noise you can hear it from other rooms. All night long we could hear "screeeeech." The water smells and tastes like sulfur. Made my clothes smell like sulfur after washing them. If you're gonna drink water, use the filtered water from the fridge. The gist: Buyer beware. If you're used to 5 star hotels, you'll be very dissapointed. If you're used to 2 star hotels, you might like it. Just know that the staff is a little clueless. One more thng... If they tell you that you booked through a third party and they didn't tell you about the "extra charges" ... stand your ground and tell them you're not paying it! Worked for me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Would come again!!”
Reviews.Author: gqmalu31
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lake Eve Resort from July 22-26. We had a 2 bedroom suite on the 5th floor. The room was very spacious. One room included two queen size, COMFORTABLE beds while the master bedroom had a king sized bed. The master bedroom had a master bathroom with a jacuzzi, his/her sinks. We had no issues with the jacuzzi like other visitors. Everything in the room was clean except for the balcony (spider-webs on the railings). I slept in the living room on the pull out sofa bed. Even that was comfortable! There were 3 32-in flat screen tvs in the room (living room and both bedrooms). The view we had of the lake was terrible. Since we were on the 5th floor of a 14 floor establishment, we saw the lake very close. It looked disgusting and there were many trees blocking the view of the rest of the lake. I'm sure that people from the top floors got a great view of the rest of the lake but we weren't as fortunate. There are fireworks from SeaWorld that are done every night. The trees blocked most of our view but we still got to see a few during our stay. We did receive about 5 menus that were slipped under our door but it didn't bother us. The pool was okay, it could have been cleaner but it did the job. There is no lifeguard at the pool and it closed at 10pm. During our stay, the pool bar was not open. The washing machine in the room was VERY loud. The first time we used it, we thought that the machine was going to take off like a rocket. Other than that, it did the job (bring laundry detergent). We were also charged $8.44 per day for "resort fees" that we were not aware of earlier. The front desk seems a little understaffed since there was a line when checking in and out. The wi-fi access is free and a great connection. If you want to use the hotel computer, it is $2.95 for 15 minutes. The hotel is about 4 minutes from SeaWorld and Aquatica and about 10-15 minutes from Universal Studios and Orlando International Airport. The hotel sign does not face the direction you will be coming from the airport. We drove past the hotel the first time we came. The hotel is right next to the Milleninum hotel resort so be sure to look for it! We did not eat at the restaurant on site. There is a great Thai restaurant near the hotel. Overall, our stay was great. The staff was more than friendly. They helped out with everything we needed. If your looking for a clean, spacious room for a great price, Lake Eve is a great pick.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Building- 2 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: imshocked2
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful facility - its being destroyed by poor management and incompetent staff. no remote in the bedroom ( found under the bed when we checked out- indicates less than thorough cleaning after previous guest). mold shot out of the jets on the tub, no toiletries in the guest bath, lights were burned out in bedroom and kitchen, wasp nests on the balcony, the restaraunt was closed because of low occupancy, next day the breakfast bar was opened but the food was horrible and OLD. Weeds growing out of the pool deck, On check in the desk staff were more interested in making fun of a guest after his telephone inquiry than they were in checking me in. Desk staff couuld not give a receipt because I booked through an outside website- even though they charged addl fees to my card. A boy spit from the balcony above onto my guest. AND THIS IS THE SHORT LIST!!!! Its very sad that such a beautiful facility is subject to problem employees. With just minimal effort, this place could be a 5 STAR Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: marilene25
Reviews.Content: I am sooo happy ...this hotel more than I expected..very clean..quiet...good location...my kids just love it ...roomy...great pool ...great internet...smell good...I am nor going to find other hotel in orlando ...this will be my second home in Orlando ...you can book it ...100% sure ...I love ir ...I want to came back ...

Reviews.Title: “In complete awe”
Reviews.Author: gigemzach
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just awesome!! It was such an awesome value. The rooms were very large. They had nice tvs, wonderful kitchen that was stocked, two bedrooms kept our family from fighting, and a nice dining room. All of the complaints that past people had seem to have been solved. The only complaint that we had, was that everyday we would come back with little fliers stuck under our door. Oh, and slow internet, but no biggie. AWESOME HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, Immaculate!”
Reviews.Author: inkystuff
Reviews.Content: I can't complain about anything our stay, really. The location was on the quiet end of International Drive, but still very convenient to all the attractions, including SeaWorld, which was just 2 miles away. The hotel was quiet, the pool was wonderful and the rooms are great. Something tells me this was meant to be condos and then at last minute they decided to change it to a hotel... which is great. We had breakfast included with our room every day, and let me tell you, the breakfast was ok for being free, but I was won over by the nice lady that runs it every day. If you read this, I can't remember your name, but I will always remember how friendly you were to our family every day we were there. My two boys still talk about you and we've been home a couple weeks. I didn't like the lady that ran the weekend buffet... I think her name was Helen, though i'm certainly not 100% on that. I hope this restaurant is still there when we return next week, as is the lady who ran the breakfast. She told me it was in transition to a new owner or something like that. There are not enough guests in the hotel to keep the restaurant running as is, so they need to do something. I can't complain about lack of staff, we never really needed anything. That was my main concern after reading all the reviews. First of all, the condo units are very well supplied with towels and there are in-room laundry facilities so there should be no need to request more towels, especially since they provide towels for the pool. Each and every day we had a maid at least knock on our door to see if we needed anything. If we weren't there they would come in and do a "light" cleaning. Every 3rd day we were there, they would come in and do a full cleaning. The units were very clean, and everything was fresh. The view out the windows and doorwall were very nice overlooking the pool. Some people complain about the sun not being on the pool all day. I liked that fact. I had my 4 month old infant with us, so I preferred keeping her out of the sun during the day. We spent most of our time swimming in either the morning or after the sun was far enough down that the building shaded the pool. Also, if you are on in the left wing of the building, or the center left, you can easily see the SeaWorld fireworks each night. I'm not sure, but I bet you could see Disney's fireworks if you were on the other side. You can definitely hear them for sure! I really hope they stay in business because I think things can only get better for them. I loved it! I can't wait to stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL AND ROOMY”
Reviews.Author: dalphoebe
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room with A LOT of space! Very clean. A great view of the pool. Nice big pool. Easy check in. We had a lot of fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Great Location and New in 2009.”
Reviews.Author: STLTravelDave
Reviews.Content: Just completed a trip to Orlando, Florida where I stayed in 3 places - Star Island, Westgate Blue Tree Resort and Lake Eve Resort. Will post reviews on all three places. Stayed 3 nights in a 3 bedroom in June 2009. Hotel was tremendous. Rooms are large and very modern. Since the hotel has only been open for 4 months, there are some obvious kinks - all of which are minor (e.g., Restaurant is rarely open. Bar is never open. Front Desk is understaffed.) I got an incredible deal through Travelocity. $89 for a 3BR 2BA room. My guess is this hotel was experiencing low occupancy so they sold a block of rooms to Travelocity for an unbelievably low price. This was an absolute bargain. Front desk was kind of confused but I rate that to being a new staff. Rooms are massive. Pool is great. Location is wonderful right next to Floridays, Sheraton Vistana Villages, The Fountains, etc. Definitely need a car to get around. W/D and full kitchen is a great plus. Fitness room only has 4 machines with 2 of those being treadmills. Also has 2 saunas. Everything was brand new and first class. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value I have ever had in Orlando! It sets the bar high for future visits!”
Reviews.Author: Butch2099
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on this hotel I was a bit leery about what it would really be like. After staying there I felt the need to come and post what a positive experience it was. First of all, having a FULL kitchen and a washer & dryer has now set the standard for future Orlando visits. Packing less clothes and being to save money on eating out was HUGE! The location was great, right near a Publix (grocery store), outlet shopping, & Sea World. We were able to be at Universal Studios or Disney in about 20 minutes. If you are looking for a clean place to sleep,eat, shower & wash clothes between hitting the parks this is it! If you are looking for it as your "destination" it probably isn't what you are looking for. Don't get me wrong, the pool was a nice size & clean with plenty of chairs but that was it to do in the hotel. I never saw the bar open like other reviewers said but again that didn't matter to us. Other reviews stated no security & poor front desk service. I called a few days ahead to verify my reservation because I had booked through Expedia (which had a better price than the hotel itself could offer) and I wanted to verify that we were in the system & would be a very late arrival. The person I spoke to said she was busy at the moment and asked if she could call me back, which she did within the hour. When we arrived even later than we expected (due to airline delay) it was 2:30 am and the front desk person checked us in and had uniformed security escort us to our room which I thought was nice. So there is some security there. I definitely would go back and reccomend it to anyone staying in Orlando who is there for the parks. I will also throw in here that parking was an issue for a couple of days that we were there. The hotel was full and I'm guessing there is 1 spot for every room and someone parked a trailered boat taking up 5 spots for 3 days and if you got in late there you had to make your own spot. The hotel was good about you parking in the front lobby area as long as you werent in a fire lane. But who tells the boat guy that that's ok knowing the hotel is full?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...will definately go back!”
Reviews.Author: Badelv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort with my daughters and their young children for 6 nights. The resort was wonderful. The place was clean and the maid service was great. I especially liked the two bedroom suite we were in. The rooms were spacious and very attractive, there had all the comforts of home.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms - Service and Amenities need work”
Reviews.Author: Cherylh407
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 4 night stay in a 3 bedroom suite on the 12th floor. We originally booked at the new Homewood Suites, but it wasn't ready so we were givenaccomdations at Lake Eve. As many have stated, the layout of the suite is wonderful and having a full kitchen is a bonus. The washer and dryer in the unit made "laundry day" much easier. I have absolutely no complaint about the amount of space and the unit itself. Comfortable furniture and matresses throughout the unit. There were, however, some problems with Lake Eve Resort. The front desk is understaffed, and it seems, undertrained and not terribly professional. No real interest taken in guests questions or concerns. One night, half the hotel lost power and all of the hotel lost internet and cable. After calling the front desk several times with no answer, we gave up and joined many people on their balconies wondering what had happened. No one was sent to the rooms to let guests know what was wrong or when the electricity would be back on. Being on the 12th floor, I didn't want to chance the elevator to the lobby in case the other half of the building went out, and really didn't want to climb back up 12 stories of stairs. When I asked the next morning what happened...I was told...I don't know, but three other hotels lost power too. Housekeeping did come by early each morning. Although we weren't ready to leave the room, they were happy to exchange towels and give us fresh supplies of soap, toilet paper etc., which worked out fine. If you need the internet for work while you are here (as I did), don't hold your breath. Internet connections were iffy at best and when they did work were terribly slow. The best signal I got in 4 days was "poor". When I asked the front desk about connectivity, I was simply told to call the internet provider. There are two hard wired computers in the lobby but you are charged in 15 minute increments for using them. Management seemed unsure of how to run a hotel/resort. Perhaps because it is a new property they need time, but the management and staff seemed terribly unprepared for guests. No phone books, no information about the resort itself was provided. The restaurant in the lobby seemed to be open on random days and on other days, not at all. Luggage carts are difficult to come by. Each night we returned home to a myriad of "pizza" ads shoved under our door, yet when we asked the front desk to recommend somehwere, you are told they don't make recommendations. Finally on another night, a front desk employee gave us the name and number of a local pizza place that delivers. Overall, the building and units themselves are beautiful. Had the management/front desk personnel been more attentive I would have given Eve Lake a 5 star rating. However the understaffed, undertrained employees and lack of detail would make me think twice about re-booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...Price was excellent for what we received”
Reviews.Author: rockets3
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night stay in a 2 bedroom unit. Very well decorated and very comfortable. Clean!!! Maid service came every day just past noon. The kids and spouse loved the pool. The internet connect was frustrating at times, extremely slow but at least I was able to get some things accomplished using it. The service staff was very friendly all though they could use another person at the desk but the check-in in and out was quick, they even allowed us to check in 2 hours early which was a very welcome relief after driving 14 hours to get there. During our stay the power did go out for half of the building one evening for about 3 hours, not a good thing but we were one of the lucky ones, we only lost our cable and phone service. The place was packed during our stay and there wasn't enough parking spaces, especially when a guest was allowed to take up 5 spaces with their boat. Also, there are no stairs that you can take, you must use the elevators going up, I wasn't big on that. Over all this was a good place to stay with a great price. As long as you can get a good rate ($102) for a 2 bedroom, we will be back. Yes, there are other places that are better, but I am sure you will pay top dollar for those places as I have done in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Spacious, great pool, great location”
Reviews.Author: Luckybeckyblue
Reviews.Content: After reading a couple of negative reviews, we were a little wary, but our experience was excellent. We were delighted with this hotel. The condo was quiet, spacious and very clean. Comfortable living room with sofa and chair/ottoman. Nice kitchen with granite counters, equipped with basic cooking needs including dishes, pots & pans, and full size appliances. Master bedroom had a very comfortable king size bed, master bath with whirlpool tub and large walk in shower. Second bedroom had two queen beds. The second bath was perfect for our kids. Lots of closet space. Large balcony overlooking the pool and Lake Eve was very nice. In-room washer and dryer was a lifesaver-- we didn't have to pack so many clothes (take some laundry soap powder), and simply washed clothes as needed during our week long stay. We have no complaints, but a couple of suggestions. There was no dishrag or liquid dish soap in the kitchen (one packet of dishwasher soap was provided per day). We had to use a washcloth to clean the kitchen and had nothing to scrub pots. If you are planning to do any cooking, as we did, you may want to pack a scrubber and some dish soap. Hopefully the hotel will consider adding these supplies in the future. Otherwise the kitchen was well supplied. We cooked a full breakfast each day and some simple suppers, saving us a ton of money compared to eating out. The pool was fabulous. Plenty of lounge chairs, large pool plus kiddie pool and hot tub. We didn't use the restaurant. It did not seem to be open all the time but this was not a concern for us. Check in and check out were fast and completely trouble-free. There was plently of parking on weekdays, but it filled up on the weekend (this was during the last 2 games of the NBA finals, with Orlando Magic playing at home -- possibly this contributed to the crowded parking on the weekend). Location was great, easy to get to, very close to Disneyworld. We drove ourselves, did not try to use the hotel shuttle. Grocery store and drug store just around the corner. Absolutely perfect vacation spot for us. Very, very comfortable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: hackmom
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Lake Eve Resort. It is a great location. There is a grocery store just down the street and it is only a few miles from Sea World and the Disney Parks. The room was gorgeous, and the service was excellent. The beds were so comfortable that we had a hard time waking up in the mornings. The kids thought that we were staying in a castle. The pool was beautiful and always full of kids and adults having a great time. We are looking into opportunities to return to Florida and we would stay at Lake Eve again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay Was Great!”
Reviews.Author: prettyboi
Reviews.Content: Our room was spaceous and comfortable. The location was very convenient to all of the theme parks. Although there weren't many staff, they were all very friendly. 1 of our 3 flat screens didn't work but otherwise our room was problem free. Yes, the housekeepers do arrive early, but we told them to come back later and we reminded the front desk and when got back our room was tidy. The housekeepers even came in and washed our dirty dishes on our last day! We were able to get wi-fi throughout our two bedroom and it wasn't the fastest out there, but it got the job done. Anyone that complains about the small service related issues is just nit-picking. Our stay was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: CamilleT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the 2 bedroom units April 15-19. It wasn't crowded at all, and check-in was really easy. The place is new, and our unit was clean and spacious. It had a full kitchen with beautiful granite counters and new appliances. Everything worked well. We had no problems with slow internet or poor service. It seemed appropriately staffed based on the occupancy, and the front desk staff were helpful and friendly. It's located on the quieter end of International Blvd, and close to Sea World, Disney and Universal. This place is essentially a condo complex with low, promotional hotel rates. I suspect that most of the people who are crabbing about it were expecting condominium amenities, luxury hotel service, with Motel 6 prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Accomodations...way understaffed!”
Reviews.Author: amybrow
